59 /*
60  * IS_USER_EVENT
61  * IS_CLASSEVENT
62  *
63  * Note:
64  * Shorthand macros for determing if an event constant represents
65  * one of the "user" events or one of the "class" events.
66  *
67  */
68 
69 #define IS_USER_EVENT(event) \
70  ((event) == TR_EVENT_COMMIT || \
71  (event) == TR_EVENT_ROLLBACK || \
72  (event) == TR_EVENT_ABORT || \
73  (event) == TR_EVENT_TIMEOUT)
74 
75 /* TR_EVENT_NULL and TR_EVENT_ALL are treated as class events */
76 #define IS_CLASS_EVENT(event) (!IS_USER_EVENT(event))

263 /*
264  * time_as_string() - The function returns a illuminating string for a time
265  * constant.
266  * return: const char
267  * tr_time(in): execution time
268  *
269  */
270 static const char *
271 time_as_string (DB_TRIGGER_TIME tr_time)
272 {
273  const char *return_str;
274 
275  switch (tr_time)
276  {
277  case TR_TIME_NULL:
278  return_str = "NULL";
279  break;
280 
281  case TR_TIME_BEFORE:
282  return_str = "BEFORE";
283  break;
284 
285  case TR_TIME_AFTER:
286  return_str = "AFTER";
287  break;
288 
289  case TR_TIME_DEFERRED:
290  return_str = "DEFERRED";
291  break;
292 
293  default:
294  return_str = "UNKNOWN";
295  break;
296  }
297 
298  return return_str;
299 }

301 /* UTILITIES */

303 /*
304  * tr_process_name() - This copies and processes a trigger name string.
305  * return: trigger name string
306  * str(in): proposed name string
307  *
308  * Note:
309  * The processing for trigger names is similar to that for class names.
310  * The name must not contain any invalid characters as defined by sm_check_name and will be downcased before
311  * it is assigned.
312  */
313 static char *
314 tr_process_name (const char *name_string)
315 {
316  char buffer[SM_MAX_IDENTIFIER_LENGTH + 2];
317  char *name = NULL;
318 
319  if (sm_check_name (name_string))
320  {
321  sm_downcase_name (name_string, buffer, SM_MAX_IDENTIFIER_LENGTH);
322  name = strdup (buffer);
323  }
324  return name;
325 }

330 /*
331  * make_activity() - Construct an activity structure.
332  * return: allocate and initialize an activity structure
333  */
334 static TR_ACTIVITY *
335 make_activity (void)
336 {
337  TR_ACTIVITY *act;
338 
339  act = (TR_ACTIVITY *) malloc (sizeof (TR_ACTIVITY));
340  if (act == NULL)
341  {
342  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, sizeof (TR_ACTIVITY));
343  return NULL;
344  }
345 
346  act->type = TR_ACT_NULL;
347  act->time = TR_TIME_NULL;
348  act->source = NULL;
349  act->parser = NULL;
350  act->statement = NULL;
351  act->exec_cnt = 0;
352 
353  return act;
354 }
355 
356 /*
357  * free_activity() - This frees storage for an activity.
358  * return: none
359  * activity(in): activity to free
360  */
361 static void
362 free_activity (TR_ACTIVITY * activity)
363 {
364  if (activity == NULL)
365  {
366  return;
367  }
368 
369  if (activity->source)
370  {
371  free_and_init (activity->source);
372  }
373 
374  if (activity->parser != NULL)
375  {
376  /*
377  * We need to free the statement explicitly here since it may
378  * contain pointers to db_values in the workspace.
379  */
380  parser_free_tree ((PARSER_CONTEXT *) activity->parser, (PT_NODE *) activity->statement);
381  parser_free_parser ((PARSER_CONTEXT *) activity->parser);
382  }
383  free_and_init (activity);
384 }

387 /* TRIGGER STRUCTURES */
388 
389 /*
390  * tr_make_trigger() - Memory allocation function for TR_TRIGGER
391  * return: a TR_TRIGGER pointer
392  *
393  */
394 static TR_TRIGGER *
395 tr_make_trigger (void)
396 {
397  TR_TRIGGER *trigger;
398 
399  trigger = (TR_TRIGGER *) malloc (sizeof (TR_TRIGGER));
400  if (trigger == NULL)
401  {
402  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, sizeof (TR_TRIGGER));
403  return NULL;
404  }
405 
406  trigger->owner = NULL;
407  trigger->object = NULL;
408  trigger->name = NULL;
409  trigger->status = TR_STATUS_INVALID;
410  trigger->priority = TR_LOWEST_PRIORITY;
411  trigger->event = TR_EVENT_NULL;
412  trigger->class_mop = NULL;
413  trigger->attribute = NULL;
414  trigger->class_attribute = 0;
415  trigger->condition = NULL;
416  trigger->action = NULL;
417  trigger->current_refname = NULL;
418  trigger->temp_refname = NULL;
419  trigger->chn = NULL_CHN;
420  trigger->comment = NULL;
421 
422  return trigger;
423 }
424 
425 /*
426  * tr_clear_trigger() - This clears the contents of a trigger.
427  * return: none
428  * trigger(in): trigger to clear
429  *
430  * Note:
431  * Don't clear the cache pointer since it remains valid.
432  * Since we cant alter the trigger class/owner etc. without deleting
433  * the trigger, we probably don't need to reset those fields either.
434  */
435 static void
436 tr_clear_trigger (TR_TRIGGER * trigger)
437 {
438  if (trigger == NULL)
439  {
440  return;
441  }
442 
443  /* make sure to clear any DB_OBJECT* pointers for garbage collection */
444  trigger->owner = NULL;
445  trigger->object = NULL;
446  trigger->class_mop = NULL;
447 
448  if (trigger->name)
449  {
450  free_and_init (trigger->name);
451  }
452  if (trigger->attribute)
453  {
454  free_and_init (trigger->attribute);
455  }
456  if (trigger->condition)
457  {
458  free_activity (trigger->condition);
459  trigger->condition = NULL;
460  }
461  if (trigger->action)
462  {
463  free_activity (trigger->action);
464  trigger->action = NULL;
465  }
466  if (trigger->comment != NULL)
467  {
468  free_and_init (trigger->comment);
469  }
470 }
471 
472 /*
473  * free_trigger() - Frees all storage for an allocated trigger.
474  * return: none
475  * trigger(in): trigger to free
476  *
477  */
478 static void
479 free_trigger (TR_TRIGGER * trigger)
480 {
481  if (trigger)
482  {
483  tr_clear_trigger (trigger);
484  free_and_init (trigger);
485  }
486 }

491 /*
492  * tr_free_trigger_list() - Memory free function for TR_TRIGLIST.
493  * return: none
494  * list(in): pointer to a trigger list
495  *
496  * Note:
497  * Since these things can go in the schema cache attached to the class,
498  * use WS_ALLOC to avoid warnings when shutting down the database.
499  */
500 void
501 tr_free_trigger_list (TR_TRIGLIST * list)
502 {
503  TR_TRIGLIST *node, *next;
504 
505  for (node = list, next = NULL; node != NULL; node = next)
506  {
507  next = node->next;
508  db_ws_free (node);
509  }
510 }
511 
512 /*
513  * insert_trigger_list() - This inserts a node in a triglist for a new trigger structure.
514  * return: error code
515  * list(in/out): pointer to a list head
516  * trigger(in): trigger to insert
517  *
518  * Note:
519  * The nodes in the triglist are ordered based on trigger priority.
520  * Since these things can go in the schema cache attached to the class,
521  * use WS_ALLOC to avoid warnings when shutting down the database.
522  */
523 static int
524 insert_trigger_list (TR_TRIGLIST ** list, TR_TRIGGER * trigger)
525 {
526  TR_TRIGLIST *t, *prev, *new_tr;
527 
528  /* scoot up to the appropriate position in the list */
529  for (t = *list, prev = NULL; t != NULL && t->trigger->priority > trigger->priority; prev = t, t = t->next)
530  ;
531 
532  /* make a new node and link it in */
533  new_tr = (TR_TRIGLIST *) db_ws_alloc (sizeof (TR_TRIGLIST));
534  if (new_tr == NULL)
535  {
536  assert (er_errid () != NO_ERROR);
537  return er_errid ();
538  }
539 
540  new_tr->trigger = trigger;
541  new_tr->next = t;
542  new_tr->prev = prev;
543  new_tr->target = NULL;
544 
545  if (t != NULL)
546  {
547  t->prev = new_tr;
548  }
549 
550  if (prev == NULL)
551  {
552  *list = new_tr;
553  }
554  else
555  {
556  prev->next = new_tr;
557  }
558 
559  return NO_ERROR;
560 }

562 /*
563  * Hack on this, it could be better.
564  *
565  * Need to fix this so that it pays attention to the filter_inactive flag.
566  */
567 
568 
569 /*
570  * merge_trigger_list() - This adds the contents of one sorted trigger list to another.
571  * return: none
572  * list(in/out): pointer to a list head
573  * more(in): list to merge
574  * destructive(in): non-zero if the new list can be physically combined
575  *
576  * Note:
577  * It is used to combine the various sorted trigger lists to construct
578  * the consolodated trigger list for a particular event.
579  * Since these things can go in the schema cache attached to the class,
580  * use WS_ALLOC to avoid warnings when shutting down the database.
581  */
582 static int
583 merge_trigger_list (TR_TRIGLIST ** list, TR_TRIGLIST * more, int destructive)
584 {
585  TR_TRIGLIST *t1, *t2, *prev, *new_tr, *t2_next;
586  int error;
587 
588  /* quick exit if nothing to do */
589  if (more == NULL)
590  {
591  return NO_ERROR;
592  }
593 
594  t1 = *list;
595  t2 = more;
596  prev = NULL;
597 
598  while (t2 != NULL)
599  {
600  t2_next = t2->next;
601 
602  /* scoot up to the appropriate position in the list */
603  for (; t1 != NULL && t1->trigger->priority > t2->trigger->priority; prev = t1, t1 = t1->next)
604  ;
605 
606  if (destructive)
607  {
608  new_tr = t2;
609  }
610  else
611  {
612  new_tr = (TR_TRIGLIST *) db_ws_alloc (sizeof (TR_TRIGLIST));
613  if (new_tr == NULL)
614  {
615  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
616  return error;
617  }
618  new_tr->trigger = t2->trigger;
619  new_tr->target = NULL;
620  }
621 
622  new_tr->next = t1;
623  new_tr->prev = prev;
624 
625  if (prev == NULL)
626  {
627  *list = new_tr;
628  }
629  else
630  {
631  prev->next = new_tr;
632  }
633 
634  if (t1 != NULL)
635  {
636  t1->prev = new_tr;
637  }
638 
639  prev = new_tr;
640  t2 = t2_next;
641  }
642 
643  return NO_ERROR;
644 }
645 
646 /*
647  * remove_trigger_list_element() - This removes a particular element from a trigger list.
648  * return: none
649  * list(in/out): trigger list
650  * element(in): trigger list element
651  *
652  * Note:
653  * It is assumed that the given element actually exists in the list.
654  *
655  */
656 static void
657 remove_trigger_list_element (TR_TRIGLIST ** list, TR_TRIGLIST * element)
658 {
659  if (element->prev == NULL)
660  {
661  *list = element->next;
662  }
663  else
664  {
665  element->prev->next = element->next;
666  }
667 
668  if (element->next != NULL)
669  {
670  element->next->prev = element->prev;
671  }
672 
673  element->next = NULL;
674  tr_free_trigger_list (element);
675 }
676 
677 /*
678  * remove_trigger_list() - This removes a trigger from a trigger list.
679  * return: none
680  * list(in/out): trigger list
681  * trigger(in): trigger to remove
682  *
683  */
684 static void
685 remove_trigger_list (TR_TRIGLIST ** list, TR_TRIGGER * trigger)
686 {
687  TR_TRIGLIST *element;
688 
689  for (element = *list; element != NULL && element->trigger != trigger; element = element->next)
690  ;
691 
692  if (element != NULL)
693  {
694  remove_trigger_list_element (list, element);
695  }
696 }
697 
698 /*
699  * reinsert_trigger_list() - This is used primarily to implement the altering of trigger priorities.
700  * return: none
701  * list(in/out): trigger list pointer
702  * trigger(in): trigger to insert/re-insert
703  *
704  * Note:
705  * It will search a trigger list for the given trigger,
706  * if the trigger is found in the list, it will be removed from its current location and re-inserted in the list
707  * based on its current priority. If the trigger isn't in the list, it does nothing.
708  *
709  */
710 static void
711 reinsert_trigger_list (TR_TRIGLIST ** list, TR_TRIGGER * trigger)
712 {
713  TR_TRIGLIST *element;
714 
715  for (element = *list; element != NULL && element->trigger != trigger; element = element->next)
716  ;
717 
718  /*
719  * note, since we just freed a triglist element, it should be possible
720  * to allocated a new one without error, need to have these in
721  * a resource for faster allocation.
722  */
723  if (element != NULL)
724  {
725  remove_trigger_list_element (list, element);
726  insert_trigger_list (list, trigger);
727  }
728 }
729 
730 /* DEFERRED ACTIVITY MAINTENANCE */
731 
732 /*
733  * add_deferred_activity_context() - This adds another element to the deferred activity list.
734  * return: new context structure
735  *
736  * Note:
737  * This adds another element to the deferred activity list.
738  * This is called once to establish the initial context and will also be called each time
739  * a subsequent savepoint context is required.
740  */
741 static TR_DEFERRED_CONTEXT *
742 add_deferred_activity_context (void)
743 {
744  TR_DEFERRED_CONTEXT *def;
745 
746  def = (TR_DEFERRED_CONTEXT *) malloc (sizeof (TR_DEFERRED_CONTEXT));
747  if (def == NULL)
748  {
749  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, sizeof (TR_DEFERRED_CONTEXT));
750  return NULL;
751  }
752 
753  def->next = NULL;
754  def->prev = NULL;
755  def->head = NULL;
756  def->tail = NULL;
757  def->savepoint_id = (void *) -1;
758 
759  if (tr_Deferred_activities == NULL)
760  {
761  tr_Deferred_activities = def;
762  tr_Deferred_activities_tail = def;
763  }
764  else
765  {
766  tr_Deferred_activities_tail->next = def;
767  def->prev = tr_Deferred_activities_tail;
768  }
769 
770  return def;
771 }
772 
773 /*
774  * add_deferred_activities() - This adds a list of triggers to the current deferred activity context.
775  * return: error code
776  * triggers(in): trigger list
777  * current(in): associated target object
778  *
779  * Note:
780  * If a context has not been allocated, a new one is created.
781  * The triggers are appended to the context's trigger list.
782  * Each trigger is stamped with the current recursion level and the associated target object.
783  */
784 static int
785 add_deferred_activities (TR_TRIGLIST * triggers, MOP current)
786 {
787  TR_DEFERRED_CONTEXT *def;
788  TR_TRIGLIST *t, *last;
789 
790  def = tr_Deferred_activities_tail;
791  if (def == NULL)
792  {
793  def = add_deferred_activity_context ();
794  if (def == NULL)
795  {
796  assert (er_errid () != NO_ERROR);
797  return er_errid ();
798  }
799  }
800 
801  /* tag the list entries with the target object */
802  for (t = triggers, last = NULL; t != NULL; t = t->next)
803  {
804  last = t;
805  t->target = current;
806  }
807 
808  /* concatenate the activities to the master list */
809  if (def->head == NULL)
810  {
811  def->head = triggers;
812  }
813  else
814  {
815  def->tail->next = triggers;
816  triggers->prev = def->tail;
817  }
818 
819  def->tail = last;
820 
821  return NO_ERROR;
822 }
823 
824 /*
825  * flush_deferred_activities() - Flushes any remaining entries on the deferred activity list.
826  * return: none
827  *
828  */
829 static void
830 flush_deferred_activities (void)
831 {
832  TR_DEFERRED_CONTEXT *c, *next;
833 
834  for (c = tr_Deferred_activities, next = NULL; c != NULL; c = next)
835  {
836  next = c->next;
837  tr_free_trigger_list (c->head);
838  free_and_init (c);
839  }
840 
841  tr_Deferred_activities = tr_Deferred_activities_tail = NULL;
842 }
843 
844 /*
845  * remove_deferred_activity() - This removes an element from the trigger list
846  * of a deferred activity context.
847  * return: none
848  * context(in): activity context
849  * element(in): activity to remove
850  *
851  */
852 static void
853 remove_deferred_activity (TR_DEFERRED_CONTEXT * context, TR_TRIGLIST * element)
854 {
855  if (context->tail == element)
856  {
857  context->tail = element->prev;
858  }
859 
860  remove_trigger_list_element (&context->head, element);
861 }
862 
863 /*
864  * remove_deferred_context() - Removes an activity context from the global list
865  * This can happen if the context's trigger list becomes empty.
866  * return: none
867  * context(in): context
868  *
869  */
870 static void
871 remove_deferred_context (TR_DEFERRED_CONTEXT * context)
872 {
873  if (context->prev != NULL)
874  {
875  context->prev->next = context->next;
876  }
877  else
878  {
879  if (context->next == NULL)
880  {
881  tr_Deferred_activities = tr_Deferred_activities_tail = NULL;
882  }
883  else
884  {
885  tr_Deferred_activities = context->next;
886  }
887  }
888 
889  free_and_init (context);
890 }
891 
892 #if defined(ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION)
893 /*
894  * tr_set_savepoint() - This establishes a new context for scheduling deferred trigger activities.
895  * return: error code
896  * savepoint_id(in): savepoint id
897  *
898  * Note:
899  * It will be called by the transaction manager whenever a savepoint is established.
900  */
901 int
902 tr_set_savepoint (void *savepoint_id)
903 {
904  TR_DEFERRED_CONTEXT *def;
905 
906  def = tr_Deferred_activities_tail;
907  if (def != NULL && def->head != NULL)
908  {
909  /* mark this with the supplied savepoint id */
910  def->savepoint_id = savepoint_id;
911 
912  /* build a new one on top of this */
913  if (add_deferred_activity_context ())
914  {
915  assert (er_errid () != NO_ERROR);
916  return er_errid ();
917  }
918  }
919  return NO_ERROR;
920 }
921 
922 /*
923  * tr_abort_to_savepoint() - This aborts the activity contexts back to
924  * a context with an id that matches the supplied id.
925  * return: error code
926  * savepoint_id(in): savepoint id to abort back to
927  *
928  */
929 int
930 tr_abort_to_savepoint (void *savepoint_id)
931 {
932  TR_DEFERRED_CONTEXT *save, *prev;
933 
934  for (save = tr_Deferred_activities_tail, prev = NULL; save != NULL && save->savepoint_id != savepoint_id; save = prev)
935  {
936  prev = save->prev;
937  /* throw away the scheduled triggers */
938  tr_free_trigger_list (save->head);
939  free_and_init (save);
940  }
941 
942  if (save != NULL)
943  {
944  save->next = NULL;
945  }
946 
947  return NO_ERROR;
948 }
949 #endif /* ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION */
950 
951 /* TRIGGER STATE STRUCTURES */
952 
953 /*
954  * make_state() - Memory allocation function for TR_STATE.
955  * return: TR_STATE *
956  *
957  */
958 static TR_STATE *
959 make_state (void)
960 {
961  TR_STATE *state;
962 
963  state = (TR_STATE *) malloc (sizeof (TR_STATE));
964  if (state == NULL)
965  {
966  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, sizeof (TR_STATE));
967  return NULL;
968  }
969 
970  state->triggers = NULL;
971 
972  return state;
973 }
974 
975 /*
976  * free_state() - Frees a trigger state structure.
977  *
978  * return: none
979  * state(in): state structure to free
980  *
981  */
982 static void
983 free_state (TR_STATE * state)
984 {
985  if (state)
986  {
987  tr_free_trigger_list (state->triggers);
988  free_and_init (state);
989  }
990 }
991 
992 
993 /* TRIGGER INSTANCES */
994 
995 /*
996  * The trigger instance is used to store the trigger definition in the database.
997  * When the trigger is brought into memory, it is converted into a run-time trigger structure for fast access.
998  * See the trigger object map below.
999  *
1000  */
1001 
1002 /*
1003  * trigger_to_object() - This converts a trigger trigger into a database object
1004  * return: trigger database object
1005  * trigger(in/out): trigger structure
1006  *
1007  */
1008 static DB_OBJECT *
1009 trigger_to_object (TR_TRIGGER * trigger)
1010 {
1011  DB_OBJECT *object_p, *class_p;
1012  DB_OTMPL *obt_p;
1013  DB_VALUE value;
1014  int save, err;
1015  MOBJ obj;
1016 
1017  AU_DISABLE (save);
1018 
1019  object_p = NULL;
1020  obt_p = NULL;
1021 
1022  class_p = db_find_class (TR_CLASS_NAME);
1023  if (class_p == NULL)
1024  {
1025  goto error;
1026  }
1027 
1028  obt_p = dbt_create_object_internal (class_p);
1029  if (obt_p == NULL)
1030  {
1031  goto error;
1032  }
1033 
1034  db_make_object (&value, trigger->owner);
1035  if (dbt_put_internal (obt_p, TR_ATT_OWNER, &value) != NO_ERROR)
1036  {
1037  goto error;
1038  }
1039 
1040  db_make_string (&value, trigger->name);
1041  if (dbt_put_internal (obt_p, TR_ATT_NAME, &value) != NO_ERROR)
1042  {
1043  goto error;
1044  }
1045 
1046  db_make_int (&value, trigger->status);
1047  if (dbt_put_internal (obt_p, TR_ATT_STATUS, &value) != NO_ERROR)
1048  {
1049  goto error;
1050  }
1051 
1052  db_make_float (&value, (float) trigger->priority);
1053  if (dbt_put_internal (obt_p, TR_ATT_PRIORITY, &value) != NO_ERROR)
1054  {
1055  goto error;
1056  }
1057 
1058  db_make_int (&value, trigger->event);
1059  if (dbt_put_internal (obt_p, TR_ATT_EVENT, &value) != NO_ERROR)
1060  {
1061  goto error;
1062  }
1063 
1064  db_make_object (&value, trigger->class_mop);
1065  if (dbt_put_internal (obt_p, TR_ATT_CLASS, &value) != NO_ERROR)
1066  {
1067  goto error;
1068  }
1069 
1070  db_make_string (&value, trigger->attribute);
1071  if (dbt_put_internal (obt_p, TR_ATT_ATTRIBUTE, &value) != NO_ERROR)
1072  {
1073  goto error;
1074  }
1075 
1076  db_make_int (&value, trigger->class_attribute);
1077  if (dbt_put_internal (obt_p, TR_ATT_CLASS_ATTRIBUTE, &value) != NO_ERROR)
1078  {
1079  goto error;
1080  }
1081 
1082  if (trigger->condition != NULL)
1083  {
1084  db_make_int (&value, trigger->condition->type);
1085  if (dbt_put_internal (obt_p, TR_ATT_CONDITION_TYPE, &value) != NO_ERROR)
1086  {
1087  goto error;
1088  }
1089 
1090  db_make_int (&value, trigger->condition->time);
1091  if (dbt_put_internal (obt_p, TR_ATT_CONDITION_TIME, &value) != NO_ERROR)
1092  {
1093  goto error;
1094  }
1095 
1096  db_make_string (&value, trigger->condition->source);
1097  if (dbt_put_internal (obt_p, TR_ATT_CONDITION, &value) != NO_ERROR)
1098  {
1099  goto error;
1100  }
1101  }
1102 
1103  if (trigger->action != NULL)
1104  {
1105  db_make_int (&value, trigger->action->type);
1106  if (dbt_put_internal (obt_p, TR_ATT_ACTION_TYPE, &value) != NO_ERROR)
1107  {
1108  goto error;
1109  }
1110 
1111  db_make_int (&value, trigger->action->time);
1112  if (dbt_put_internal (obt_p, TR_ATT_ACTION_TIME, &value) != NO_ERROR)
1113  {
1114  goto error;
1115  }
1116 
1117  db_make_string_copy (&value, trigger->action->source);
1118  err = dbt_put_internal (obt_p, TR_ATT_ACTION, &value);
1119  if (err != NO_ERROR)
1120  {
1121  /* hack, try old name before aborting */
1122  err = dbt_put_internal (obt_p, TR_ATT_ACTION_OLD, &value);
1123  if (err != NO_ERROR)
1124  {
1125  pr_clear_value (&value);
1126  goto error;
1127  }
1128  }
1129  pr_clear_value (&value);
1130  }
1131 
1132  db_make_string_copy (&value, trigger->comment);
1133  err = dbt_put_internal (obt_p, TR_ATT_COMMENT, &value);
1134  pr_clear_value (&value);
1135  if (err != NO_ERROR)
1136  {
1137  goto error;
1138  }
1139 
1140  object_p = dbt_finish_object (obt_p);
1141  if (object_p != NULL)
1142  {
1143  trigger->object = object_p;
1144  obt_p = NULL;
1145 
1146  /* get the object CHN so we know this template is still valid; get dirty version, as we need lock for triggers fetch */
1147  if (au_fetch_instance_force (object_p, &obj, AU_FETCH_READ, LC_FETCH_DIRTY_VERSION) == 0)
1148  {
1149  trigger->chn = WS_CHN (obj);
1150  }
1151  else
1152  {
1153  /* shoudln't happen, make sure the trigger is disconnected */
1154  trigger->object = NULL;
1155  object_p = NULL;
1156  }
1157  }
1158 
1159 error:
1160  if (obt_p != NULL)
1161  {
1162  dbt_abort_object (obt_p);
1163  }
1164 
1165  AU_ENABLE (save);
1166  return object_p;
1167 }
1168 
1169 /*
1170  * object_to_trigger() - This converts a trigger object from the database into a C structure.
1171  * return: error code
1172  * object(in): trigger object
1173  * trigger(in/out): trigger structure to fill in
1174  *
1175  */
1176 static int
1177 object_to_trigger (DB_OBJECT * object, TR_TRIGGER * trigger)
1178 {
1179  DB_VALUE value;
1180  int save;
1181  MOBJ obj;
1182  SM_CLASS *class_;
1183  char *tmp;
1184 
1185  AU_DISABLE (save);
1186 
1187  /* initialize the trigger to a known default state */
1188  trigger->owner = NULL;
1189  trigger->object = object;
1190  trigger->name = NULL;
1191  trigger->status = TR_STATUS_INVALID;
1192  trigger->priority = TR_LOWEST_PRIORITY;
1193  trigger->event = TR_EVENT_NULL;
1194  trigger->class_mop = NULL;
1195  trigger->attribute = NULL;
1196  trigger->condition = NULL;
1197  trigger->action = NULL;
1198  trigger->comment = NULL;
1199 
1200  /*
1201  * Save the cache coherency number so we know when to re-calculate the
1202  * cache. Get the last dirty version.
1203  */
1204  if (au_fetch_instance_force (object, &obj, AU_FETCH_READ, TM_TRAN_READ_FETCH_VERSION ()))
1205  {
1206  goto error;
1207  }
1208 
1209  trigger->chn = WS_CHN (obj);
1210 
1211  /* OWNER */
1212  if (db_get (object, TR_ATT_OWNER, &value))
1213  {
1214  goto error;
1215  }
1216 
1217  if (DB_VALUE_TYPE (&value) == DB_TYPE_OBJECT)
1218  {
1219  if (DB_IS_NULL (&value))
1220  {
1221  trigger->owner = NULL;
1222  }
1223  else
1224  {
1225  trigger->owner = db_get_object (&value);
1226  }
1227  }
1228 
1229  /* NAME */
1230  if (db_get (object, TR_ATT_NAME, &value))
1231  {
1232  goto error;
1233  }
1234 
1235  if (DB_VALUE_TYPE (&value) == DB_TYPE_STRING && !DB_IS_NULL (&value))
1236  {
1237  tmp = db_get_string (&value);
1238  if (tmp)
1239  {
1240  trigger->name = strdup (tmp);
1241  }
1242  }
1243  db_value_clear (&value);
1244 
1245  /* STATUS */
1246  if (db_get (object, TR_ATT_STATUS, &value))
1247  {
1248  goto error;
1249  }
1250 
1251  if (DB_VALUE_TYPE (&value) == DB_TYPE_INTEGER)
1252  {
1253  trigger->status = (DB_TRIGGER_STATUS) db_get_int (&value);
1254  }
1255 
1256  /* PRIORITY */
1257  if (db_get (object, TR_ATT_PRIORITY, &value))
1258  {
1259  goto error;
1260  }
1261 
1262  if (DB_VALUE_TYPE (&value) == DB_TYPE_DOUBLE)
1263  {
1264  trigger->priority = db_get_double (&value);
1265  }
1266 
1267  /* EVENT */
1268  if (db_get (object, TR_ATT_EVENT, &value))
1269  {
1270  goto error;
1271  }
1272 
1273  if (DB_VALUE_TYPE (&value) == DB_TYPE_INTEGER)
1274  {
1275  trigger->event = (DB_TRIGGER_EVENT) db_get_int (&value);
1276  }
1277 
1278  /* CLASS */
1279  if (db_get (object, TR_ATT_CLASS, &value))
1280  {
1281  goto error;
1282  }
1283 
1284  if (DB_VALUE_TYPE (&value) == DB_TYPE_OBJECT)
1285  {
1286  if (DB_IS_NULL (&value))
1287  {
1288  trigger->class_mop = NULL;
1289  }
1290  else
1291  {
1292  trigger->class_mop = db_get_object (&value);
1293  }
1294  /*
1295  * Check to make sure the class is still available. It is possible
1296  * that the class can be deleted and it wasn't possible to inform
1297  * the associated trigger objects of that fact.
1298  */
1299  if (trigger->class_mop != NULL)
1300  {
1301  if (au_fetch_class_force (trigger->class_mop, &class_, AU_FETCH_READ) == ER_HEAP_UNKNOWN_OBJECT)
1302  {
1303  trigger->status = TR_STATUS_INVALID;
1304  }
1305  }
1306  }
1307 
1308  /* ATTRIBUTE */
1309  if (db_get (object, TR_ATT_ATTRIBUTE, &value))
1310  {
1311  goto error;
1312  }
1313 
1314  if (DB_VALUE_TYPE (&value) == DB_TYPE_STRING && !DB_IS_NULL (&value))
1315  {
1316  tmp = db_get_string (&value);
1317  if (tmp)
1318  {
1319  trigger->attribute = strdup (tmp);
1320  }
1321  }
1322 
1323  db_value_clear (&value);
1324 
1325  /* CLASS ATTRIBUTE */
1326  if (db_get (object, TR_ATT_CLASS_ATTRIBUTE, &value))
1327  {
1328  goto error;
1329  }
1330 
1331  if (DB_VALUE_TYPE (&value) == DB_TYPE_INTEGER)
1332  {
1333  trigger->class_attribute = db_get_int (&value);
1334  }
1335 
1336  /* CONDITION TYPE */
1337  if (db_get (object, TR_ATT_CONDITION_TYPE, &value))
1338  {
1339  goto error;
1340  }
1341 
1342  if (DB_VALUE_TYPE (&value) == DB_TYPE_INTEGER)
1343  {
1344  trigger->condition = make_activity ();
1345  if (trigger->condition == NULL)
1346  {
1347  goto error;
1348  }
1349 
1350  trigger->condition->type = (DB_TRIGGER_ACTION) db_get_int (&value);
1351 
1352  /* CONDITION TIME */
1353  if (db_get (object, TR_ATT_CONDITION_TIME, &value))
1354  {
1355  goto error;
1356  }
1357 
1358  if (DB_VALUE_TYPE (&value) == DB_TYPE_INTEGER)
1359  {
1360  trigger->condition->time = (DB_TRIGGER_TIME) db_get_int (&value);
1361  }
1362 
1363  /* CONDITION SOURCE */
1364  if (db_get (object, TR_ATT_CONDITION, &value))
1365  {
1366  goto error;
1367  }
1368 
1369  if (DB_VALUE_TYPE (&value) == DB_TYPE_STRING && !DB_IS_NULL (&value))
1370  {
1371  tmp = db_get_string (&value);
1372  if (tmp)
1373  {
1374  trigger->condition->source = strdup (tmp);
1375  }
1376  }
1377  db_value_clear (&value);
1378  }
1379 
1380  /* ACTION TYPE */
1381  if (db_get (object, TR_ATT_ACTION_TYPE, &value))
1382  {
1383  goto error;
1384  }
1385 
1386  if (DB_VALUE_TYPE (&value) == DB_TYPE_INTEGER)
1387  {
1388  trigger->action = make_activity ();
1389  if (trigger->action == NULL)
1390  {
1391  goto error;
1392  }
1393 
1394  trigger->action->type = (DB_TRIGGER_ACTION) db_get_int (&value);
1395 
1396  /* ACTION TIME */
1397  if (db_get (object, TR_ATT_ACTION_TIME, &value))
1398  {
1399  goto error;
1400  }
1401 
1402  if (DB_VALUE_TYPE (&value) == DB_TYPE_INTEGER)
1403  {
1404  trigger->action->time = (DB_TRIGGER_TIME) db_get_int (&value);
1405  }
1406 
1407  /* ACTION SOURCE */
1408  if (db_get (object, TR_ATT_ACTION, &value))
1409  {
1410  /* hack, try old name if error */
1411  if (db_get (object, TR_ATT_ACTION_OLD, &value))
1412  {
1413  goto error;
1414  }
1415  }
1416 
1417  if (DB_VALUE_TYPE (&value) == DB_TYPE_STRING && !DB_IS_NULL (&value))
1418  {
1419  tmp = db_get_string (&value);
1420  if (tmp)
1421  {
1422  trigger->action->source = strdup (tmp);
1423  }
1424  }
1425  db_value_clear (&value);
1426  }
1427 
1428  /* COMMENT */
1429  if (db_get (object, TR_ATT_COMMENT, &value))
1430  {
1431  goto error;
1432  }
1433 
1434  if (DB_VALUE_TYPE (&value) == DB_TYPE_STRING && !DB_IS_NULL (&value))
1435  {
1436  tmp = db_get_string (&value);
1437  if (tmp != NULL)
1438  {
1439  trigger->comment = strdup (tmp);
1440  }
1441  }
1442  db_value_clear (&value);
1443 
1444  AU_ENABLE (save);
1445  return NO_ERROR;
1446 
1447 error:
1448  AU_ENABLE (save);
1449 
1450  assert (er_errid () != NO_ERROR);
1451  return er_errid ();
1452 }
1453 
1454 
1455 /* EXPRESSION COMPILATION */
1456 
1457 /*
1458  * get_reference_names() - This determines which of the various reference names are valid for a particular trigger expression
1459  * return: none
1460  * trigger(in): trigger of interest
1461  * activity(in): action
1462  * curname(out): current name (returned)
1463  * tempname(out): temp name (returned)
1464  *
1465  */
1466 static void
1467 get_reference_names (TR_TRIGGER * trigger, TR_ACTIVITY * activity, const char **curname, const char **tempname)
1468 {
1469  *curname = NULL;
1470  *tempname = NULL;
1471 
1472  if (!prm_get_bool_value (PRM_ID_MYSQL_TRIGGER_CORRELATION_NAMES))
1473  {
1474  switch (trigger->event)
1475  {
1476  case TR_EVENT_INSERT:
1477  switch (activity->time)
1478  {
1479  case TR_TIME_BEFORE:
1480  *tempname = NEW_REFERENCE_NAME;
1481  break;
1482  case TR_TIME_AFTER:
1483  case TR_TIME_DEFERRED:
1484  *curname = OBJ_REFERENCE_NAME;
1485  break;
1486  default:
1487  break;
1488  }
1489  break;
1490 
1491  case TR_EVENT_UPDATE:
1492  switch (activity->time)
1493  {
1494  case TR_TIME_BEFORE:
1495  *curname = OBJ_REFERENCE_NAME;
1496  *tempname = NEW_REFERENCE_NAME;
1497  break;
1498  case TR_TIME_AFTER:
1499  *curname = OBJ_REFERENCE_NAME;
1500  *tempname = OLD_REFERENCE_NAME;
1501  break;
1502  case TR_TIME_DEFERRED:
1503  *curname = OBJ_REFERENCE_NAME;
1504  break;
1505  default:
1506  break;
1507  }
1508  break;
1509 
1510  case TR_EVENT_DELETE:
1511  switch (activity->time)
1512  {
1513  case TR_TIME_BEFORE:
1514  *curname = OBJ_REFERENCE_NAME;
1515  break;
1516  case TR_TIME_AFTER:
1517  case TR_TIME_DEFERRED:
1518  break;
1519  default:
1520  break;
1521  }
1522  break;
1523 
1524  default:
1525  break;
1526  }
1527  }
1528  else
1529  {
1530  switch (trigger->event)
1531  {
1532  case TR_EVENT_INSERT:
1533  switch (activity->time)
1534  {
1535  case TR_TIME_BEFORE:
1536  *tempname = NEW_REFERENCE_NAME;
1537  break;
1538  case TR_TIME_AFTER:
1539  case TR_TIME_DEFERRED:
1540  *curname = NEW_REFERENCE_NAME;
1541  break;
1542  default:
1543  break;
1544  }
1545  break;
1546 
1547  case TR_EVENT_UPDATE:
1548  switch (activity->time)
1549  {
1550  case TR_TIME_BEFORE:
1551  *curname = OLD_REFERENCE_NAME;
1552  *tempname = NEW_REFERENCE_NAME;
1553  break;
1554  case TR_TIME_AFTER:
1555  *curname = NEW_REFERENCE_NAME;
1556  *tempname = OLD_REFERENCE_NAME;
1557  break;
1558  case TR_TIME_DEFERRED:
1559  *curname = NEW_REFERENCE_NAME;
1560  break;
1561  default:
1562  break;
1563  }
1564  break;
1565 
1566  case TR_EVENT_DELETE:
1567  switch (activity->time)
1568  {
1569  case TR_TIME_BEFORE:
1570  *curname = OLD_REFERENCE_NAME;
1571  break;
1572  case TR_TIME_AFTER:
1573  case TR_TIME_DEFERRED:
1574  break;
1575  default:
1576  break;
1577  }
1578  break;
1579 
1580  default:
1581  break;
1582  }
1583  }
1584 }
1585 
1586 /*
1587  * compile_trigger_activity() - This is used to compile the condition or action expressions of a trigger.
1588  * return: error code
1589  * trigger(in): trigger being updated
1590  * activity(in): activity to compile
1591  * with_evaluate(in):
1592  *
1593  * Note:
1594  * Normally this is done once and then left cached in the trigger structure
1595  * It will be recompiled if the trigger object is changed in any way.
1596  * This is detected by examining the cache coherency number for the trigger object.
1597  * When this changes the cache (including the parse trees) will be flushed and the parse trees will be generated again.
1598  * Parse trees must also be generated after a trigger has been loaded from disk for the first time.
1599  */
1600 static int
1601 compile_trigger_activity (TR_TRIGGER * trigger, TR_ACTIVITY * activity, int with_evaluate)
1602 {
1603  int error = NO_ERROR;
1604  const char *curname, *tempname;
1605  DB_OBJECT *class_mop;
1606  char *text;
1607  int length;
1608  PT_NODE *err;
1609  int stmt, line, column;
1610  const char *msg;
1611  PT_NODE **node_ptr;
1612 
1613  if (activity != NULL && activity->type == TR_ACT_EXPRESSION && activity->source != NULL)
1614  {
1615  if (activity->parser != NULL)
1616  {
1617  parser_free_parser ((PARSER_CONTEXT *) activity->parser);
1618  activity->parser = NULL;
1619  activity->statement = NULL;
1620  }
1621 
1622  /* build a string suitable for compilation */
1623  if (!with_evaluate)
1624  {
1625  text = activity->source;
1626  }
1627  else
1628  {
1629  length = strlen (EVAL_PREFIX) + strlen (activity->source) + strlen (EVAL_SUFFIX) + 1;
1630  text = (char *) malloc (length);
1631  if (text == NULL)
1632  {
1633  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, (size_t) length);
1634  return er_errid ();
1635  }
1636  strcpy (text, EVAL_PREFIX);
1637  strcat (text, activity->source);
1638  strcat (text, EVAL_SUFFIX);
1639  }
1640 
1641  /* get a parser for this statement */
1642  activity->parser = parser_create_parser ();
1643  if (activity->parser == NULL)
1644  {
1645  assert (er_errid () != NO_ERROR);
1646  return er_errid ();
1647  }
1648 
1649  get_reference_names (trigger, activity, &curname, &tempname);
1650 
1651  /*
1652  * The pt_ interface doesn't like the first name to be NULL and the second name to be non-NULL.
1653  * For cases like BEFORE INSERT where we have a temp object but no "real" object, shift the tempname down to the curname.
1654  * Must remember to do the same thing when the objects are passed to pt_exec_trigger_stmt()
1655  */
1656 
1657  if (curname == NULL)
1658  {
1659  curname = tempname;
1660  tempname = NULL;
1661  }
1662 
1663  /*
1664  * if both correlation names are NULL, don't pass in the class pointer
1665  * because it adds an empty FROM clause to the expression which results in compile errors
1666  */
1667  class_mop = ((curname == NULL && tempname == NULL) ? NULL : trigger->class_mop);
1668 
1669  activity->statement =
1670  pt_compile_trigger_stmt ((PARSER_CONTEXT *) activity->parser, text, class_mop, curname, tempname);
1671  if (activity->statement == NULL || pt_has_error ((PARSER_CONTEXT *) activity->parser))
1672  {
1673  error = er_errid ();
1674  /* Do not overwrite UNILATERALLY ABORTED error */
1675  if (!ER_IS_ABORTED_DUE_TO_DEADLOCK (error))
1676  {
1677  err = pt_get_errors ((PARSER_CONTEXT *) activity->parser);
1678  if (err == NULL)
1679  {
1680  /* missing compiler error list */
1681  error = ER_TR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
1682  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 1, trigger->name);
1683  }
1684  else
1685  {
1686  error = ER_EMERGENCY_ERROR;
1687  while (err != NULL)
1688  {
1689  err = pt_get_next_error (err, &stmt, &line, &column, &msg);
1690  er_set (ER_SYNTAX_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 1, msg);
1691  }
1692 
1693  /* package up the last error into a general trigger error */
1694  error = (with_evaluate) ? ER_TR_CONDITION_COMPILE : ER_TR_ACTION_COMPILE;
1695  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 2, trigger->name, msg);
1696  }
1697  }
1698 
1699  /*
1700  * since we had a problem with the compilation, don't leave
1701  * the parser hanging around in the trigger cache
1702  */
1703  if (activity->statement)
1704  {
1705  parser_free_tree ((PARSER_CONTEXT *) activity->parser, (PT_NODE *) activity->statement);
1706  }
1707  activity->statement = NULL;
1708  parser_free_parser ((PARSER_CONTEXT *) activity->parser);
1709  activity->parser = NULL;
1710  }
1711 
1712  if (activity->statement)
1713  {
1714  /*
1715  * We can't allow the user to have a before insert trigger that uses the OID of the new value.
1716  * i.e. they can reference "new.a" but not "new". Let's walk the statement and look for this case.
1717  */
1718  if (trigger->event == TR_EVENT_INSERT && activity->time == TR_TIME_BEFORE)
1719  {
1720  node_ptr = &((PT_NODE *) activity->statement)->info.scope.stmt;
1721  *node_ptr =
1722  parser_walk_tree ((PARSER_CONTEXT *) activity->parser, *node_ptr, NULL, NULL, tr_check_correlation,
1723  NULL);
1724  if (pt_has_error ((PARSER_CONTEXT *) activity->parser))
1725  {
1726  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TR_CORRELATION_ERROR, 0);
1727  error = er_errid ();
1728  parser_free_tree ((PARSER_CONTEXT *) activity->parser, (PT_NODE *) activity->statement);
1729  activity->statement = NULL;
1730  parser_free_parser ((PARSER_CONTEXT *) activity->parser);
1731  activity->parser = NULL;
1732  }
1733  }
1734  }
1735 
1736  /* free the computed string */
1737  if (with_evaluate)
1738  {
1739  free_and_init (text);
1740  }
1741  }
1742 
1743  return error;
1744 }
1745 
1746 /* TRIGGER STRUCTURE & OBJECT MAP */
1747 
1748 
1749 /*
1750  * validate_trigger() - This is used to check the validity of a cached trigger structure.
1751  * return: error code
1752  * trigger(in/out): trigger structure
1753  *
1754  * Note:
1755  * This is used to check the validity of a cached trigger structure.
1756  * It should be called once before any API level trigger operation takes place.
1757  * Among other things, this must make sure the condition and action statements are compiled and ready to go.
1758  * It also checks "quickly" to see if the associated trigger instance was modified since the last time the trigger
1759  * was cached. This could be faster.
1760  */
1761 static int
1762 validate_trigger (TR_TRIGGER * trigger)
1763 {
1764  MOBJ obj;
1765  TR_TRIGGER new_trigger;
1766  int error;
1767 
1768  /*
1769  * should have a quicker lock check mechanism, could call
1770  * locator directly here if it speeds things up
1771  * Get the current version, not the latest one.
1772  */
1773 
1774  if (au_fetch_instance_force (trigger->object, &obj, AU_FETCH_READ, TM_TRAN_READ_FETCH_VERSION ()))
1775  {
1776  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
1777  return error;
1778  }
1779 
1780  if (trigger->chn != WS_CHN (obj))
1781  {
1782  /* cache coherency numbers have changed, recache */
1783 
1784  if (object_to_trigger (trigger->object, &new_trigger))
1785  {
1786  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
1787  return error;
1788  }
1789 
1790  tr_clear_trigger (trigger);
1791  *trigger = new_trigger;
1792 
1793  if (compile_trigger_activity (trigger, trigger->condition, 1))
1794  {
1795  trigger->status = TR_STATUS_INVALID;
1796  if (ER_IS_ABORTED_DUE_TO_DEADLOCK (er_errid ()))
1797  {
1798  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
1799  return error;
1800  }
1801  }
1802 
1803  if (compile_trigger_activity (trigger, trigger->action, 0))
1804  {
1805  trigger->status = TR_STATUS_INVALID;
1806  if (ER_IS_ABORTED_DUE_TO_DEADLOCK (er_errid ()))
1807  {
1808  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
1809  return error;
1810  }
1811  }
1812 
1813  }
1814 
1815  return NO_ERROR;
1816 }
1817 
1818 /*
1819  * tr_map_trigger() - This creates a trigger cache structure for a trigger instance and optionally validates the cache.
1820  * return: trigger structure
1821  * object(in): trigger object handle
1822  * fetch(in): non-zero if the cache is to be updated
1823  *
1824  * Note:
1825  * This creates a trigger cache structure for a trigger instance and optionally validates the cache.
1826  * This is used whenever a trigger object handle needs to be mapped into a trigger structure.
1827  * The structure will be created if one has not yet been allocated.
1828  * This is called by the schema manager when a class is loaded in order to build the class trigger cache list.
1829  * In this case, the fetch flag is off so we don't cause recursive fetches during the transformation of the class object.
1830  * It is also called by the trigger API functions which take MOPs as arguments but which need to convert these
1831  * to the run-time trigger structures.
1832  * In these cases, the fetch flag is set because the trigger will need to be immediately validated.
1833  *
1834  */
1835 TR_TRIGGER *
1836 tr_map_trigger (DB_OBJECT * object, int fetch)
1837 {
1838  TR_TRIGGER *trigger = NULL;
1839 
1840  trigger = (TR_TRIGGER *) mht_get (tr_object_map, (void *) object);
1841  if (trigger != NULL)
1842  {
1843  if (fetch && validate_trigger (trigger) != NO_ERROR)
1844  {
1845  trigger = NULL;
1846  }
1847  }
1848  else
1849  {
1850  trigger = tr_make_trigger ();
1851  if (trigger != NULL)
1852  {
1853  if (object_to_trigger (object, trigger) != NO_ERROR)
1854  {
1855  free_trigger (trigger);
1856  trigger = NULL;
1857  }
1858  else
1859  {
1860  if (mht_put (tr_object_map, object, trigger) == NULL)
1861  {
1862  free_trigger (trigger);
1863  trigger = NULL;
1864  }
1865  }
1866  }
1867  }
1868 
1869  return trigger;
1870 }
1871 
1872 /*
1873  * tr_unmap_trigger() - This is used to release a reference to a trigger structure.
1874  * return: error code
1875  * trigger(in): trigger structure
1876  *
1877  * Note:
1878  * This is used to release a reference to a trigger structure.
1879  * The trigger can be removed from the mapping table and freed.
1880  * This MUST ONLY be called if the caller knows that there will be no other references to this trigger structure.
1881  * This is the case for most class triggers.
1882  * If this cannot be guaranteed, the trigger can simply be left in the mapping table and it will be freed during shutdown.
1883  *
1884  */
1885 int
1886 tr_unmap_trigger (TR_TRIGGER * trigger)
1887 {
1888  int error = NO_ERROR;
1889 
1890  /* better make damn sure that the caller is the only one that could be referencing this trigger structure */
1891  if (mht_rem (tr_object_map, trigger->object, NULL, NULL) != NO_ERROR)
1892  {
1893  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
1894  }
1895 
1896  return error;
1897 }
1898 
1899 /* USER TRIGGER CACHE */
1900 
1901 /*
1902  * The user object has an attribute that may contain a sequence of trigger object pointers.
1903  * These were once in the au_ module but since they don't really need any special support there,
1904  * they were* moved here to keep au_ from having to know too much about triggers.
1905  * The triggers in this list are only the "user" level triggers such as COMMIT, ABORT, TIMEOUT, and ROLLBACK.
1906  * These triggers are extracted from the user object and placed in a global trigger cache list.
1907  * This saves the expense of performing the usual db_get() operations to extract the trigger info every time
1908  * a user event happens. Proper maintenance of the cache depends on the function tr_check_rollback_triggers being called
1909  * inside the tran_abort() function. When the transaction is rolled back, we universally invalidate the user cache
1910  * so that it can be recalculated for the next transaction.
1911  * We only really need to do this if the user object was modified during the transaction.
1912  *
1913  */
1914 
1915 /*
1916  * register_user_trigger() - This stores a new trigger object inside the current user object
1917  * return: error code
1918  * object(in): trigger object
1919  *
1920  * Note:
1921  * If successful, it will recalculate the user trigger cache list as well.
1922  */
1923 static int
1924 register_user_trigger (DB_OBJECT * object)
1925 {
1926  int error = NO_ERROR;
1927  DB_SET *table;
1928  DB_VALUE value;
1929  int save;
1930 
1931  AU_DISABLE (save);
1932 
1933  if (Au_user != NULL && (error = obj_inst_lock (Au_user, 1)) == NO_ERROR
1934  && (error = obj_get (Au_user, "triggers", &value)) == NO_ERROR)
1935  {
1936  if (DB_IS_NULL (&value))
1937  {
1938  table = NULL;
1939  }
1940  else
1941  {
1942  table = db_get_set (&value);
1943  }
1944 
1945  if (table == NULL)
1946  {
1947  table = set_create_sequence (0);
1948  db_make_sequence (&value, table);
1949  obj_set (Au_user, "triggers", &value);
1950  /*
1951  * remember, because of coercion, we have to either set the domain properly to begin with or
1952  * we have to get the coerced set back out after it has been assigned
1953  */
1954  set_free (table);
1955  obj_get (Au_user, "triggers", &value);
1956  if (DB_IS_NULL (&value))
1957  {
1958  table = NULL;
1959  }
1960  else
1961  {
1962  table = db_get_set (&value);
1963  }
1964  }
1965 
1966  db_make_object (&value, object);
1967  error = set_insert_element (table, 0, &value);
1968  /* if an error is set, probably must abort the transaction */
1969  }
1970 
1971  AU_ENABLE (save);
1972 
1973  if (error == NO_ERROR)
1974  {
1975  tr_User_triggers_modified = 1;
1976  tr_update_user_cache ();
1977  }
1978 
1979  return error;
1980 }
1981 
1982 /*
1983  * unregister_user_trigger() - This removes a trigger from the user object and associated caches
1984  * return: error code
1985  * trigger(in): trigger structure
1986  * rollback(in): non-zero if we're performing a rollback
1987  *
1988  * Note:
1989  * This removes a trigger from the user object and associated caches.
1990  * If the rollback flag is set, it indicates that we're trying to
1991  * remove a trigger that was defined during the current transaction.
1992  * In that case, try to be more tolerant of errors that may occurr.
1993  */
1994 static int
1995 unregister_user_trigger (TR_TRIGGER * trigger, int rollback)
1996 {
1997  int error = NO_ERROR;
1998  DB_SET *table;
1999  DB_VALUE value;
2000  int save;
2001 
2002  if (rollback)
2003  {
2004  /*
2005  * Carefully remove it from the user cache first, if we have
2006  * errors touching the user object then at least it will be
2007  * out of the cache
2008  */
2009  (void) remove_trigger_list (&tr_User_triggers, trigger);
2010  }
2011 
2012  AU_DISABLE (save);
2013 
2014  if (Au_user != NULL && (error = obj_inst_lock (Au_user, 1)) == NO_ERROR
2015  && (error = obj_get (Au_user, "triggers", &value)) == NO_ERROR)
2016  {
2017  if (DB_IS_NULL (&value))
2018  {
2019  table = NULL;
2020  }
2021  else
2022  {
2023  table = db_get_set (&value);
2024  }
2025 
2026  if (table != NULL)
2027  {
2028  db_make_object (&value, trigger->object);
2029  error = set_drop_element (table, &value, false);
2030  set_free (table);
2031  }
2032  /* else, should have "trigger not found" error ? */
2033  }
2034 
2035  AU_ENABLE (save);
2036 
2037  /* don't bother updating the cache now if its a rollback */
2038  if (error == NO_ERROR && !rollback)
2039  {
2040  tr_User_triggers_modified = 1;
2041  tr_update_user_cache ();
2042  }
2043 
2044  return error;
2045 }
2046 
2047 /*
2048  * get_user_trigger_objects() - This is used to build and return a list of all the user triggers currently defined
2049  * return: error code
2050  * event(in): event type
2051  * active_filter(in): non-zero to filter out inactive triggers
2052  * trigger_list(in/out): returned list of trigger obects
2053  *
2054  */
2055 static int
2056 get_user_trigger_objects (DB_TRIGGER_EVENT event, bool active_filter, DB_OBJLIST ** trigger_list)
2057 {
2058  int error = NO_ERROR;
2059  DB_SET *table;
2060  DB_VALUE value;
2061  DB_TRIGGER_EVENT e;
2062  TR_TRIGGER *trigger;
2063  int max, i;
2064 
2065  *trigger_list = NULL;
2066 
2067  if (Au_user == NULL)
2068  {
2069  return NO_ERROR;
2070  }
2071 
2072  error = obj_get (Au_user, "triggers", &value);
2073  if (error != NO_ERROR)
2074  {
2075  return error;
2076  }
2077 
2078  if (DB_IS_NULL (&value))
2079  {
2080  table = NULL;
2081  }
2082  else
2083  {
2084  table = db_get_set (&value);
2085  }
2086 
2087  if (table != NULL)
2088  {
2089  error = set_filter (table);
2090  max = set_size (table);
2091 
2092  for (i = 0; i < max && error == NO_ERROR; i++)
2093  {
2094  error = set_get_element (table, i, &value);
2095  if (error == NO_ERROR)
2096  {
2097  if (DB_VALUE_TYPE (&value) == DB_TYPE_OBJECT && !DB_IS_NULL (&value) && db_get_object (&value) != NULL)
2098  {
2099  /* deleted objects should have been filtered by now */
2100  trigger = tr_map_trigger (db_get_object (&value), 1);
2101  if (trigger == NULL)
2102  {
2103  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
2104  }
2105  else
2106  {
2107  if (!active_filter || trigger->status == TR_STATUS_ACTIVE)
2108  {
2109  if (event == TR_EVENT_NULL)
2110  {
2111  /* unconditionally collect all the trigger objects */
2112  error = ml_ext_add (trigger_list, db_get_object (&value), NULL);
2113  }
2114  else
2115  {
2116  /* must check for a specific event */
2117  error = tr_trigger_event (db_get_object (&value), &e);
2118  if (error == NO_ERROR)
2119  {
2120  if (e == event)
2121  {
2122  error = ml_ext_add (trigger_list, db_get_object (&value), NULL);
2123  }
2124  }
2125  }
2126  }
2127  }
2128  }
2129  }
2130  }
2131 
2132  set_free (table);
2133  }
2134 
2135  if (error != NO_ERROR && *trigger_list != NULL)
2136  {
2137  ml_ext_free (*trigger_list);
2138  *trigger_list = NULL;
2139  }
2140 
2141  return error;
2142 }
2143 
2144 /*
2145  * tr_update_user_cache() - This is used to establish the user trigger cache
2146  * return: error
2147  *
2148  * Note:
2149  * It goes through the trigger objects defined for the user, maps them to trigger objects and
2150  * stores them on specific lists for quick access.
2151  */
2152 int
2153 tr_update_user_cache (void)
2154 {
2155  int error = NO_ERROR;
2156  DB_SET *table;
2157  DB_VALUE value;
2158  TR_TRIGGER *trigger;
2159  int max, i;
2160 
2161  tr_User_triggers_valid = 0;
2162  if (tr_User_triggers != NULL)
2163  {
2164  tr_free_trigger_list (tr_User_triggers);
2165  tr_User_triggers = NULL;
2166  }
2167 
2168  if (Au_user != NULL && (error = obj_get (Au_user, "triggers", &value)) == NO_ERROR)
2169  {
2170  if (DB_IS_NULL (&value))
2171  {
2172  table = NULL;
2173  }
2174  else
2175  {
2176  table = db_get_set (&value);
2177  }
2178 
2179  if (table != NULL)
2180  {
2181  error = set_filter (table);
2182  max = set_size (table);
2183 
2184  for (i = 0; i < max && error == NO_ERROR; i++)
2185  {
2186  error = set_get_element (table, i, &value);
2187  if (error == NO_ERROR)
2188  {
2189  if (DB_VALUE_TYPE (&value) == DB_TYPE_OBJECT && !DB_IS_NULL (&value)
2190  && db_get_object (&value) != NULL)
2191  {
2192  /* deleted objects will have been filtered by now */
2193  trigger = tr_map_trigger (db_get_object (&value), 1);
2194  if (trigger == NULL)
2195  {
2196  assert (er_errid () != NO_ERROR);
2197  error = er_errid ();
2198  }
2199  else
2200  {
2201  error = insert_trigger_list (&tr_User_triggers, trigger);
2202  }
2203  }
2204  }
2205  }
2206 
2207  set_free (table);
2208  }
2209  }
2210 
2211  if (error == NO_ERROR)
2212  {
2213  tr_User_triggers_valid = 1;
2214  }
2215  else if (tr_User_triggers != NULL)
2216  {
2217  tr_free_trigger_list (tr_User_triggers);
2218  tr_User_triggers = NULL;
2219  }
2220 
2221  return error;
2222 }
2223 
2224 #if defined(ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION)
2225 /*
2226  * tr_invalidate_user_cache() - This is called to invalidate the user trigger
2227  * cache and cause it to be recalculated the next
2228  * time a user event is encountered.
2229  * return: none
2230  *
2231  * Note:
2232  * It is intended to be called only by au_set_user() when the user
2233  * object has been changed. Since this can happen frequently under
2234  * some conditions, don't do much complicated here. Delay the actual
2235  * cache calulation until it is needed.
2236  */
2237 void
2238 tr_invalidate_user_cache (void)
2239 {
2240  tr_User_triggers_valid = 0;
2241 }
2242 #endif /* ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION */
2243 
2244 /* SCHEMA CACHE */
2245 
2246 /*
2247  * Pointers to trigger cache structures are placed directly in the schema structures
2248  * so that the triggers for a particular class/attribute can be quickly located.
2249  *
2250  */
2251 
2252 /*
2253  * tr_make_schema_cache() - This creates a schema class structure
2254  * return: schema cache structure
2255  * type(in): type of cache to create
2256  * objects(in): initial list of schema objects
2257  *
2258  * Note:
2259  * This creates a schema class structure. The length of the cache array will vary depending on the type of the cache.
2260  * Since these are going to be attached to class objects and may not get freed unless the class is specifically flushed,
2261  * we allocate them in the workspace rather than using malloc so we don't get a bunch of dangling allocation references
2262  * when we shut down.
2263  */
2264 TR_SCHEMA_CACHE *
2265 tr_make_schema_cache (TR_CACHE_TYPE type, DB_OBJLIST * objects)
2266 {
2267  TR_SCHEMA_CACHE *cache = NULL;
2268  int elements, size, i;
2269 
2270  if (type == TR_CACHE_CLASS)
2271  {
2272  elements = TR_MAX_CLASS_TRIGGERS;
2273  }
2274  else
2275  {
2276  elements = TR_MAX_ATTRIBUTE_TRIGGERS;
2277  }
2278 
2279  /* there is already space for one ponter in the structure so decrement the element count multiplier */
2280  size = sizeof (TR_SCHEMA_CACHE) + (sizeof (TR_TRIGLIST *) * (elements - 1));
2281  cache = (TR_SCHEMA_CACHE *) db_ws_alloc (size);
2282  if (cache == NULL)
2283  {
2284  return NULL;
2285  }
2286 
2287  cache->objects = objects;
2288  cache->compiled = 0;
2289  cache->array_length = elements;
2290  for (i = 0; i < elements; i++)
2291  {
2292  cache->triggers[i] = NULL;
2293  }
2294 
2295  /* add it to the global list */
2296  cache->next = tr_Schema_caches;
2297  tr_Schema_caches = cache;
2298 
2299  return cache;
2300 }
2301 
2302 /*
2303  * tr_copy_schema_cache() - This is called by the schema manager during class flattening
2304  * return: new cache
2305  * cache(in): cache to copy
2306  * filter_class(in): non-null if filtering triggers
2307  *
2308  * Note:
2309  * It creates a copy of an existing schema cache. Don't bother compiling it at this time, just copy the trigger
2310  * object list and let it get compiled the next time the class is referenced.
2311  * If the filter_class is non-NULL, the copied cache will contain only triggers that are defined with targets
2312  * directly on the filter_class. This is used to filter out triggers in the cache that were inherited from super classes.
2313  */
2314 TR_SCHEMA_CACHE *
2315 tr_copy_schema_cache (TR_SCHEMA_CACHE * cache, MOP filter_class)
2316 {
2317  TR_SCHEMA_CACHE *new_ent;
2318  TR_TRIGGER *trigger;
2319  TR_CACHE_TYPE type;
2320  DB_OBJLIST *obj_list;
2321 
2322  if (cache == NULL)
2323  {
2324  return NULL;
2325  }
2326 
2327  new_ent = NULL;
2328 
2329  type = (cache->array_length == TR_MAX_CLASS_TRIGGERS) ? TR_CACHE_CLASS : TR_CACHE_ATTRIBUTE;
2330 
2331  new_ent = tr_make_schema_cache (type, NULL);
2332  if (new_ent == NULL)
2333  {
2334  return NULL;
2335  }
2336 
2337  if (cache->objects != NULL)
2338  {
2339  if (filter_class == NULL)
2340  {
2341  new_ent->objects = ml_copy (cache->objects);
2342  if (new_ent->objects == NULL)
2343  {
2344  goto abort_it;
2345  }
2346  }
2347  else
2348  {
2349  for (obj_list = cache->objects; obj_list != NULL; obj_list = obj_list->next)
2350  {
2351  trigger = tr_map_trigger (obj_list->op, 1);
2352  if (trigger == NULL)
2353  {
2354  goto abort_it;
2355  }
2356 
2357  if (trigger->class_mop == filter_class)
2358  {
2359  if (ml_add (&new_ent->objects, obj_list->op, NULL))
2360  {
2361  goto abort_it;
2362  }
2363  }
2364  }
2365  }
2366  }
2367 
2368  return new_ent;
2369 
2370 abort_it:
2371  if (new_ent != NULL)
2372  {
2373  tr_free_schema_cache (new_ent);
2374  }
2375 
2376  return NULL;
2377 }
2378 
2379 /*
2380  * tr_merge_schema_cache() - This is a support routine called by the schema manager during class flattening.
2381  * return: error code
2382  * dest(in): destination cache
2383  * src(in): source cache
2384  *
2385  * Note:
2386  * It will merge the contents of one trigger cache with another.
2387  */
2388 int
2389 tr_merge_schema_cache (TR_SCHEMA_CACHE * destination, TR_SCHEMA_CACHE * source)
2390 {
2391  int error = NO_ERROR;
2392  DB_OBJLIST *obj_list;
2393 
2394  if (destination != NULL && source != NULL)
2395  {
2396  for (obj_list = source->objects; obj_list != NULL && !error; obj_list = obj_list->next)
2397  {
2398  error = ml_add (&destination->objects, obj_list->op, NULL);
2399  }
2400  }
2401 
2402  return error;
2403 }

2405 /*
2406  * tr_empty_schema_cache() - Looks to see if a cache is empty.
2407  * return: non-zero if the schema cache is empty
2408  * cache(in):
2409  *
2410  */
2411 int
2412 tr_empty_schema_cache (TR_SCHEMA_CACHE * cache)
2413 {
2414  return ((cache == NULL) || (cache->objects == NULL));
2415 }

2417 /*
2418  * tr_free_schema_cache() - This is called to free a schema cache.
2419  * return: none
2420  * cache(in): cache structure
2421  *
2422  * Note:
2423  * Normally this is done only when a class is deleted or swapped out of the workspace.
2424  */
2425 void
2426 tr_free_schema_cache (TR_SCHEMA_CACHE * cache)
2427 {
2428  TR_SCHEMA_CACHE *c, *prev;
2429  int i;
2430 
2431  if (cache == NULL)
2432  {
2433  return;
2434  }
2435 
2436  for (i = 0; i < cache->array_length; i++)
2437  {
2438  if (cache->triggers[i])
2439  {
2440  tr_free_trigger_list (cache->triggers[i]);
2441  }
2442  }
2443 
2444  if (cache->objects != NULL)
2445  {
2446  ml_free (cache->objects);
2447  }
2448 
2449  /* unlink it from the global list */
2450  for (c = tr_Schema_caches, prev = NULL; c != NULL && c != cache; c = c->next)
2451  {
2452  prev = c;
2453  }
2454 
2455  if (c == cache)
2456  {
2457  if (prev != NULL)
2458  {
2459  prev->next = c->next;
2460  }
2461  else
2462  {
2463  tr_Schema_caches = c->next;
2464  }
2465  }
2466 
2467  db_ws_free (cache);
2468 }
2469 
2470 /*
2471  * tr_add_cache_trigger() - This is a callback function called by the schema manager during the processing of
2472  * an sm_add_trigger request
2473  * return: error code
2474  * cache(in/out): cache pointer
2475  * trigger_object(in): trigger (object) to add
2476  *
2477  * Note:
2478  * As the schema manager walks through the class hierarchy identifying subclasses that need to inherit the trigger,
2479  * it will create caches using tr_make_schema_cache and then call tr_add_cache_trigger to add the trigger object.
2480  * If the cache has already been compiled, we map the trigger and add it to the appropriate list.
2481  * If it hasn't yet been compiled we simply add it to the object list.
2482  */
2483 int
2484 tr_add_cache_trigger (TR_SCHEMA_CACHE * cache, DB_OBJECT * trigger_object)
2485 {
2486  int error = NO_ERROR;
2487  TR_TRIGGER *trigger;
2488 
2489  if (cache == NULL)
2490  {
2491  return NO_ERROR;
2492  }
2493 
2494  error = ml_add (&cache->objects, trigger_object, NULL);
2495  if (error == NO_ERROR)
2496  {
2497  if (cache->compiled)
2498  {
2499  trigger = tr_map_trigger (trigger_object, 1);
2500  if (trigger == NULL)
2501  {
2502  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
2503  }
2504  else
2505  {
2506  error = insert_trigger_list (&(cache->triggers[trigger->event]), trigger);
2507  }
2508  }
2509  }
2510 
2511  return error;
2512 }
2513 
2514 /*
2515  * tr_drop_cache_trigger() - This is a callback function called by the schema manager during the processing of
2516  * an sm_drop_trigger request.
2517  * return: error code
2518  * cache(in): schema cache
2519  * trigger_object(in): trigger object to remove
2520  *
2521  * Note:
2522  * As the schema manager walks the class hierarchy, it will call this function to remove a particular trigger object
2523  * from the cache of each of the affected subclasses. Compare with the function tr_add_cache_trigger.
2524  */
2525 int
2526 tr_drop_cache_trigger (TR_SCHEMA_CACHE * cache, DB_OBJECT * trigger_object)
2527 {
2528  int error = NO_ERROR;
2529  TR_TRIGGER *trigger;
2530 
2531  if (cache == NULL)
2532  {
2533  return NO_ERROR;
2534  }
2535 
2536  ml_remove (&cache->objects, trigger_object);
2537  if (cache->compiled)
2538  {
2539  trigger = tr_map_trigger (trigger_object, 1);
2540  if (trigger == NULL)
2541  {
2542  assert (er_errid () != NO_ERROR);
2543  error = er_errid ();
2544  }
2545  else
2546  {
2547  (void) remove_trigger_list (&(cache->triggers[trigger->event]), trigger);
2548  }
2549  }
2550 
2551  return error;
2552 }
2553 
2554 /*
2555  * tr_get_cache_objects() - This builds an object list for all of the triggers found in a schema cache.
2556  * return: error code
2557  * cache(in): schema cache
2558  * list(out): returned object list
2559  *
2560  * Note:
2561  * This is used for storing classes on disk. Since we don't need the full trigger cache structure on disk,
2562  * we just store a list of all the associated trigger objects. When the class is brought back in,
2563  * we convert the object list back into a trigger cache.
2564  * The list returned by this function will become part of the cache if it doesn't already exist and should
2565  * NOT be freed by the caller. There shouldn't be any conditions where the list doesn't match
2566  * the cache but build it by hand just in case.
2567  */
2568 int
2569 tr_get_cache_objects (TR_SCHEMA_CACHE * cache, DB_OBJLIST ** list)
2570 {
2571  int error = NO_ERROR;
2572  int i;
2573  TR_TRIGLIST *t;
2574 
2575  *list = NULL;
2576 
2577  if (cache == NULL)
2578  {
2579  return NO_ERROR;
2580  }
2581 
2582  if (cache->objects == NULL)
2583  {
2584  for (i = 0; i < cache->array_length && !error; i++)
2585  {
2586  for (t = cache->triggers[i]; t != NULL; t = t->next)
2587  {
2588  error = ml_add (&cache->objects, t->trigger->object, NULL);
2589  }
2590  }
2591  }
2592 
2593  *list = cache->objects;
2594 
2595  return error;
2596 }
2597 
2598 /*
2599  * tr_validate_schema_cache() - This must be called by anyone that is about to "look inside" a class cache structure.
2600  * return: error
2601  * cache(in): class cache attached to schema
2602  * class_mop(in): class mop
2603  *
2604  * Note:
2605  * This must be called by anyone that is about to "look inside" a class cache structure.
2606  * It makes sure that the cache objects have been converted to trigger structures and sorted on the proper list.
2607  */
2608 int
2609 tr_validate_schema_cache (TR_SCHEMA_CACHE * cache, MOP class_mop)
2610 {
2611  int error = NO_ERROR;
2612  DB_OBJLIST *object_list, *prev, *next;
2613  TR_TRIGGER *trigger;
2614  bool mop_found;
2615 
2616  if (cache == NULL)
2617  {
2618  return NO_ERROR;
2619  }
2620  if (cache->compiled)
2621  {
2622  return NO_ERROR;
2623  }
2624 
2625  for (object_list = cache->objects, prev = NULL, next = NULL; object_list != NULL && cache != NULL; object_list = next)
2626  {
2627  next = object_list->next;
2628  trigger = tr_map_trigger (object_list->op, 1);
2629 
2630  /* check for deleted objects that need to be quietly removed */
2631  if (trigger != NULL && trigger->event < cache->array_length)
2632  {
2633  if (class_mop != NULL && ws_mop_compare (class_mop, trigger->class_mop) != 0)
2634  {
2635  if (sm_find_subclass_in_hierarchy (trigger->class_mop, class_mop, &mop_found) != NO_ERROR)
2636  {
2637  return error;
2638  }
2639 
2640  if (mop_found == false)
2641  {
2642  /*
2643  * got a bogus trigger object in the cache,
2644  * remove it
2645  */
2646 
2647  if (prev == NULL)
2648  {
2649  cache->objects = next;
2650  }
2651  else
2652  {
2653  prev->next = next;
2654  }
2655 
2656  object_list->next = NULL;
2657  ml_free (object_list);
2658 
2659  continue;
2660  }
2661  }
2662 
2663 
2664  if (insert_trigger_list (&(cache->triggers[trigger->event]), trigger))
2665  {
2666  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
2667  return error; /* memory error */
2668  }
2669  prev = object_list;
2670  }
2671  else
2672  {
2673  if (trigger == NULL && er_errid () != ER_HEAP_UNKNOWN_OBJECT)
2674  {
2675  /* we got some kind of severe error, abort */
2676  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
2677 
2678  if (ER_IS_ABORTED_DUE_TO_DEADLOCK (error))
2679  {
2680  /* UNILATERALLY ABORTED error must be returned */
2681  return error;
2682  }
2683  }
2684  else
2685  {
2686  /*
2687  * else, got a bogus trigger object in the cache,
2688  * remove it
2689  */
2690  if (prev == NULL)
2691  {
2692  cache->objects = next;
2693  }
2694  else
2695  {
2696  prev->next = next;
2697  }
2698 
2699  object_list->next = NULL;
2700  ml_free (object_list);
2701  }
2702  }
2703  }
2704 
2705  if (error == NO_ERROR)
2706  {
2707  cache->compiled = 1;
2708  }
2709 
2710  return error;
2711 }
2712 
2713 #if defined(ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION)
2714 /*
2715  * tr_reset_schema_cache() - This is called by functions that alter triggers
2716  * in such a way that the schema caches need
2717  * to be rebuilt
2718  * return: error
2719  * cache(in): cache to clear
2720  *
2721  * Note:
2722  * Currently this is called only by tr_set_priority.
2723  */
2724 
2725 int
2726 tr_reset_schema_cache (TR_SCHEMA_CACHE * cache)
2727 {
2728  int error = NO_ERROR;
2729  int i;
2730 
2731  if (cache != NULL)
2732  {
2733  /* remove the existing trigger lists if any */
2734  for (i = 0; i < cache->array_length; i++)
2735  {
2736  if (cache->triggers[i])
2737  {
2738  tr_free_trigger_list (cache->triggers[i]);
2739  cache->triggers[i] = NULL;
2740  }
2741  }
2742 
2743  cache->compiled = 0;
2744  error = tr_validate_schema_cache (cache);
2745  }
2746 
2747  return error;
2748 }
2749 #endif /* ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION */

2751 /*
2752  * reorder_schema_caches() - This finds all the schema caches that point to a particular trigger and reorders their lists
2753  * based on the new trigger priority
2754  * return: none
2755  * trigger(in/out): trigger that has been modified
2756  *
2757  * Note:
2758  * This could be more effecient if we had a more directed way to determine which caches a trigger might be on.
2759  * For now just look at all of them. Changing trigger priorities shouldn't be a very common operation so it isn't
2760  * worth walking class hierarchies at this point.
2761  */
2762 static void
2763 reorder_schema_caches (TR_TRIGGER * trigger)
2764 {
2765  TR_SCHEMA_CACHE *c;
2766  int i;
2767 
2768  for (c = tr_Schema_caches; c != NULL; c = c->next)
2769  {
2770  if (c->compiled)
2771  {
2772  for (i = 0; i < c->array_length; i++)
2773  {
2774  reinsert_trigger_list (&(c->triggers[i]), trigger);
2775  }
2776  }
2777  }
2778 }
2779 
2780 /*
2781  * tr_active_schema_cache() - This is used to determine if a cache contains active event_type triggers.
2782  * return: 0 = none, >0 = active, <0 = error
2783  * class_mop(in): class mop
2784  * cache(in): schema cache to examine
2785  * event_type(in) : event type.
2786  *
2787  * Note:
2788  * The schema manager calls this to cache the trigger activity status so that it can be faster in cases
2789  * where there are no active triggers defined for a class.
2790  * Returns -1 on error, this can only happen if there are storage allocation problems trying to build the schema cache.
2791  *
2792  */
2793 int
2794 tr_active_schema_cache (MOP class_mop, TR_SCHEMA_CACHE * cache, DB_TRIGGER_EVENT event_type,
2795  bool * has_event_type_triggers)
2796 {
2797  TR_TRIGLIST *t;
2798  int i, active;
2799  bool result = false;
2800 
2801  active = 0;
2802 
2803  if (cache != NULL)
2804  {
2805  if (tr_validate_schema_cache (cache, class_mop))
2806  {
2807  return -1;
2808  }
2809  for (i = 0; i < cache->array_length && !result; i++)
2810  {
2811  for (t = cache->triggers[i]; t != NULL && !result; t = t->next)
2812  {
2813  if (t->trigger->status == TR_STATUS_ACTIVE)
2814  {
2815  active = 1;
2816  if ((event_type == TR_EVENT_ALL) || (t->trigger->event == event_type))
2817  {
2818  result = true;
2819  }
2820  }
2821  }
2822  }
2823  }
2824 
2825  if (has_event_type_triggers)
2826  {
2827  *has_event_type_triggers = result;
2828  }
2829 
2830  return active;
2831 }
2832 
2833 /*
2834  * tr_delete_schema_cache() - This is called by the schema manager to notify the trigger manager that a class or
2835  * attribute is being deleted and the schema cache is no longer needed
2836  * return: error code
2837  * cache(in): schema cache
2838  * class_object(in): class_object
2839  *
2840  * Note:
2841  * This is different than tr_free_schema_cache because we can also mark the associated triggers as being invalid
2842  * since their targets are gone. Note that marking the triggers invalid is only performed if the trigger target class
2843  * is the same as the supplied class. This is because this function may be called by subclasses that are losing
2844  * the attribute but the attribute still exists in a super class and the trigger is still applicable to
2845  * the super class attribute.
2846  */
2847 int
2848 tr_delete_schema_cache (TR_SCHEMA_CACHE * cache, DB_OBJECT * class_object)
2849 {
2850  DB_VALUE value;
2851  DB_OBJLIST *m;
2852  TR_TRIGGER *trigger;
2853  int save;
2854 
2855  AU_DISABLE (save);
2856 
2857  /* make a value container for marking the trigger object as invalid */
2858  db_make_int (&value, (int) TR_STATUS_INVALID);
2859  if (cache != NULL)
2860  {
2861  for (m = cache->objects; m != NULL; m = m->next)
2862  {
2863  trigger = tr_map_trigger (m->op, 0);
2864 
2865  /*
2866  * if the trigger has already been marked invalid, don't
2867  * bother updating the object
2868  */
2869  if (trigger != NULL)
2870  {
2871  /*
2872  * only invalidate the trigger if it is defined directly
2873  * on this class
2874  */
2875  if (trigger->class_mop == class_object)
2876  {
2877  /*
2878  * don't bother updating the trigger object if its already
2879  * invalid
2880  */
2881  if (trigger->status != TR_STATUS_INVALID)
2882  {
2883  trigger->status = TR_STATUS_INVALID;
2884 
2885  /*
2886  * Store the status permanently in the trigger object.
2887  * This may result in an access violation, if so ignore
2888  * it but be prepared to recognize it when the trigger
2889  * is loaded again.
2890  */
2891  (void) db_put_internal (m->op, TR_ATT_STATUS, &value);
2892  }
2893  }
2894  }
2895  }
2896 
2897  tr_free_schema_cache (cache);
2898  }
2899 
2900  AU_ENABLE (save);
2901  return NO_ERROR;
2902 }
2903 
2904 /*
2905  * tr_delete_triggers_for_class - Finds all triggers on a class and deletes them one by one.
2906  * WARNING: it really deletes them, not the wimpy
2907  * delete_schema_cache() which only invalidates them.
2908  *
2909  *
2910  *
2911  * return: error code
2912  * cache(in/out): schema cache
2913  * class_object(in): class_object
2914  *
2915  * Note:
2916  * This removes only the triggers that have the given class as the trigger object, and not attributes,
2917  * or super- or subclasses. The idea is that if the user deletes a class, it is reasonable
2918  * to assume that he does not want its triggers to remain around.
2919  */
2920 int
2921 tr_delete_triggers_for_class (TR_SCHEMA_CACHE ** cache, DB_OBJECT * class_object)
2922 {
2923  TR_TRIGGER *trigger;
2924  int save;
2925  DB_OBJLIST *m;
2926  int didwork = 1;
2927  int error;
2928 
2929  if ((NULL == cache) || (*cache == NULL))
2930  {
2931  return NO_ERROR;
2932  }
2933 
2934  AU_DISABLE (save);
2935 
2936  while (didwork)
2937  {
2938  didwork = 0;
2939 
2940  /* need better error handling here */
2941  error = tr_validate_schema_cache (*cache, class_object);
2942  if (error != NO_ERROR)
2943  {
2944  break;
2945  }
2946 
2947  for (m = (*cache)->objects; m != NULL; m = m->next)
2948  {
2949  trigger = tr_map_trigger (m->op, 0);
2950  if (trigger == NULL)
2951  {
2952  continue;
2953  }
2954 
2955  if (trigger->class_mop != class_object)
2956  {
2957  continue;
2958  }
2959 
2960  error = tr_drop_trigger_internal (trigger, 0, false);
2961  if (error != NO_ERROR)
2962  {
2963  break;
2964  }
2965 
2966  didwork = 1;
2967 
2968  /* we can only delete one trigger per operation, because we need to re-validate the schema cache after each
2969  * delete, so that we can iterate through the rest of its elements. */
2970  break;
2971  }
2972  }
2973 
2974  tr_free_schema_cache (*cache);
2975  *cache = NULL;
2976 
2977  AU_ENABLE (save);
2978  return error;
2979 }

2983 /* TRIGGER TABLE */
2984 
2985 /*
2986  * This is the global trigger table. All triggers are entered into the table and must be uniquely identifiable by name.
2987  * This should be one of the new "transaction aware" hash tables on the server but until that facility is available
2988  * we have to keep a global list. The disadvantate with this approach is that there will be more contention.
2989  */
2990 
2991 /*
2992  * trigger_table_add() - Adds a trigger to the global name table
2993  * return: error code
2994  * name(in): trigger name
2995  * trigger(in): trigger object
2996  *
2997  * Note:
2998  * We can assume here that a trigger with this name does not exist
2999  */
3000 static int
3001 trigger_table_add (const char *name, DB_OBJECT * trigger)
3002 {
3003  int error = NO_ERROR;
3004  DB_SET *table = NULL;
3005  DB_VALUE value;
3006  int max, save;
3007 
3008  AU_DISABLE (save);
3009 
3010  if (Au_root == NULL)
3011  {
3012  return NO_ERROR;
3013  }
3014 
3015  error = obj_inst_lock (Au_root, 1);
3016  if (error != NO_ERROR)
3017  {
3018  return error;
3019  }
3020 
3021  error = obj_get (Au_root, "triggers", &value);
3022  if (error != NO_ERROR)
3023  {
3024  return error;
3025  }
3026 
3027  if (DB_IS_NULL (&value))
3028  {
3029  table = NULL;
3030  }
3031  else
3032  {
3033  table = db_get_set (&value);
3034  }
3035 
3036  if (table == NULL)
3037  {
3038  table = set_create_sequence (0);
3039  if (table == NULL)
3040  {
3041  error = er_errid ();
3042  if (error == NO_ERROR)
3043  {
3044  error = ER_GENERIC_ERROR;
3045  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 0);
3046  }
3047 
3048  goto end;
3049  }
3050

3052  if (error != NO_ERROR)
3053  {
3054  goto end;
3055  }
3056 
3057  error = obj_set (Au_root, "triggers", &value);
3058  if (error != NO_ERROR)
3059  {
3060  goto end;
3061  }
3062 
3063  /* remember, because of coercion, we have to either set the domain properly to begin with or
3064  * we have to get the coerced set back out after it has been assigned
3065  */
3066  set_free (table);
3067  table = NULL;
3068 
3069  error = obj_get (Au_root, "triggers", &value);
3070  if (error != NO_ERROR)
3071  {
3072  goto end;
3073  }
3074 
3075  if (DB_IS_NULL (&value))
3076  {
3077  table = NULL;
3078 
3079  goto end;
3080  }
3081  else
3082  {
3083  table = db_get_set (&value);
3084  }
3085  }

3087 
3088  db_make_string_copy (&value, name);
3089  error = set_put_element (table, max, &value);
3090  pr_clear_value (&value);
3091  if (error == NO_ERROR)
3092  {
3093  db_make_object (&value, trigger);
3094  error = set_put_element (table, max + 1, &value);
3095  /*
3096  * if we have an error at this point, we probably should abort the
3097  * transaction, we now have a partial update of the trigger
3098  * association list
3099  */
3100  }
3101 
3102  set_free (table);
3103  table = NULL;
3104 
3105 end:
3106  if (table != NULL)
3107  {
3108  set_free (table);
3109  table = NULL;
3110  }
3111 
3112  AU_ENABLE (save);
3113 
3114  return error;
3115 }

3117 /*
3118  * trigger_table_find() - This finds a trigger object by name
3119  * return: error code
3120  * name(in): trigger name
3121  * trigger_ptr(out): trigger object (returned)
3122  *
3123  * Note:
3124  * All triggers must have a globally unique name.
3125  * Should be modified to use an actual persistent table rather than the temporary in-memory table.
3126  */
3127 static int
3128 trigger_table_find (const char *name, DB_OBJECT ** trigger_p)
3129 {
3130  int error = NO_ERROR;
3131  DB_SET *table;
3132  DB_VALUE value;
3133  int max, i, found;
3134 
3135  *trigger_p = NULL;
3136  if (Au_root == NULL)
3137  {
3138  return NO_ERROR;
3139  }
3140 
3141  error = obj_get (Au_root, "triggers", &value);
3142  if (error != NO_ERROR)
3143  {
3144  return error;
3145  }
3146

3148  {
3149  table = NULL;
3150  }
3151  else
3152  {
3153  table = db_get_set (&value);
3154  }

3157  {
3158  return NO_ERROR;
3159  }

3163

3165  for (i = 0, found = -1; i < max && error == NO_ERROR && found == -1; i += 2)
3166  {
3167  error = set_get_element (table, i, &value);
3168  if (error == NO_ERROR)
3169  {

3171  && COMPARE_TRIGGER_NAMES (db_get_string (&value), name) == 0)
3172  {

3174  }
3175  pr_clear_value (&value);
3176  }
3177  }
3178 
3179  if (found != -1)
3180  {

3182  if (error == NO_ERROR)
3183  {
3184  if (DB_VALUE_TYPE (&value) == DB_TYPE_OBJECT)
3185  {
3186  if (DB_IS_NULL (&value))
3187  {
3188  *trigger_p = NULL;
3189  }
3190  else
3191  {
3192  *trigger_p = db_get_object (&value);
3193  }
3194  }
3195  pr_clear_value (&value);
3196  }
3197  }
3198  set_free (table);
3199 
3200  return error;
3201 }
