3203 /*
3204  * trigger_table_rename() - This is called when a trigger is renamed
3205  * return: error code
3206  * trigger_object(in): trigger object
3207  * newname(in): new name
3208  *
3209  * Note:
3210  * Since the name table is managed as an association list of name/object pairs, we must change the name in the table
3211  * for the associated trigger. Note that if the transaction is aborted, global trigger object is decached
3212  * so we don't have to unwind our change to the alist before rollback.
3213  */
3214 static int
3215 trigger_table_rename (DB_OBJECT * trigger_object, const char *newname)
3216 {
3217  int error = NO_ERROR;
3218  DB_SET *table;
3219  DB_VALUE value;
3220  int max, save, i, found;
3221  DB_OBJECT *exists;
3222 
3223  /* make sure we don't already have one */
3224  if (trigger_table_find (newname, &exists))
3225  {
3226  assert (er_errid () != NO_ERROR);
3227  return er_errid ();
3228  }
3229 
3230  if (exists != NULL)
3231  {
3232  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TR_TRIGGER_EXISTS, 1, newname);
3233  return er_errid ();
3234  }
3235 
3236  /* change the name */
3237  AU_DISABLE (save);
3238 
3239  if (Au_root == NULL)
3240  {
3241  goto end;
3242  }
3243 
3244  error = obj_inst_lock (Au_root, 1);
3245  if (error != NO_ERROR)
3246  {
3247  goto end;
3248  }
3249 
3250  error = obj_get (Au_root, "triggers", &value);
3251  if (error != NO_ERROR)
3252  {
3253  goto end;
3254  }
3255 
3256  if (DB_IS_NULL (&value))
3257  {
3258  table = NULL;
3259  }
3260  else
3261  {
3262  table = db_get_set (&value);
3263  }
3264 
3265  if (table == NULL)
3266  {
3267  error = ER_TR_TRIGGER_NOT_FOUND;
3268  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 1, newname);
3269  goto end;
3270  }
3271 
3272  error = set_filter (table);
3273  max = set_size (table);
3274 
3275  for (i = 1, found = -1; i < max && error == NO_ERROR && found == -1; i += 2)
3276  {
3277  error = set_get_element (table, i, &value);
3278  if (error == NO_ERROR)
3279  {
3280  if (DB_VALUE_TYPE (&value) == DB_TYPE_OBJECT && db_get_object (&value) == trigger_object)
3281  {
3282  found = i;
3283  }
3284  pr_clear_value (&value);
3285  }
3286  }
3287 
3288  if (found == -1)
3289  {
3290  error = ER_TR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
3291  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 1, newname);
3292  }
3293  else
3294  {
3295  /* the name is the kept in the element immediately preceeding this one */
3296  db_make_string_copy (&value, newname);
3297  error = set_put_element (table, found - 1, &value);
3298  pr_clear_value (&value);
3299  }
3300 
3301  set_free (table);
3302 
3303 end:
3304  AU_ENABLE (save);
3305  return error;
3306 }

3401 
3402 /*
3403  * check_authorization() - This checks authorization on a trigger structure
3404  * return: non-zero if authorization is ok
3405  * trigger(in): trigger to examine
3406  * alter_flag(in): non-zero if we're going to be modifying this trigger
3407  *
3408  * Note:
3409  * If the trigger is associated with a class, the current user must have appropriate class authorization.
3410  * If the trigger is associated with a user, the current user must be the owner of the trigger.
3411  * If the alter flag is set, it means that the trigger is about to be modified in some way.
3412  */
3413 static bool
3414 check_authorization (TR_TRIGGER * trigger, bool alter_flag)
3415 {
3416  int error;
3417  bool status = false;
3418 
3419  /* When classes are deleted, their associated triggers are marked as invalid but the triggers themselves are not
3420  * deleted. Need to recognize this. If the trigger is invalid then it can be dropped only by its owner.
3421  */
3422 
3423  if (trigger->status == TR_STATUS_INVALID)
3424  {
3425  if (au_is_dba_group_member (Au_user) || ws_is_same_object (trigger->owner, Au_user))
3426  {
3427  status = true;
3428  }
3429  }
3430  else if (IS_CLASS_EVENT (trigger->event))
3431  {
3432  if (trigger->class_mop != NULL)
3433  {
3434  /* must check authorization against the associated class */
3435  if (alter_flag)
3436  {
3437  error = au_check_authorization (trigger->class_mop, AU_ALTER);
3438  }
3439  else
3440  {
3441  error = au_check_authorization (trigger->class_mop, AU_SELECT);
3442  }
3443 
3444  if (error == NO_ERROR)
3445  {
3446  status = true;
3447  }
3448  }
3449  else
3450  {
3451  error = ER_TR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
3452  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 1, trigger->name);
3453  }
3454  }
3455  else
3456  {
3457  /* its a user trigger, must be the active user */
3458  if (ws_is_same_object (trigger->owner, Au_user))
3459  {
3460  status = true;
3461  }
3462  }
3463 
3464  return status;
3465 }

3467 /*
3468  * find_all_triggers() - Returns a list of all trigger objects that have been defined.
3469  * return: error code

3471  * alter_filter(in):
3472  * list(out): trigger list (returned)
3473  *
3474  * Note:
3475  * List must be freed by db_objlist_free (ml_ext_free) when no longer required.
3476  */
3477 static int
3478 find_all_triggers (bool active_filter, bool alter_filter, DB_OBJLIST ** list)
3479 {
3480  int error = NO_ERROR;
3481  TR_TRIGGER *trigger;
3482  DB_SET *table;
3483  DB_VALUE value;
3484  int max, i;
3485 
3486  *list = NULL;
3487 
3488  if (Au_root == NULL)
3489  {
3490  return NO_ERROR;
3491  }
3492 
3493  error = obj_get (Au_root, "triggers", &value);
3494  if (error != NO_ERROR)
3495  {
3496  return NO_ERROR;
3497  }
3498 
3499  if (DB_IS_NULL (&value))
3500  {
3501  table = NULL;
3502  }
3503  else
3504  {
3505  table = db_get_set (&value);
3506  }
3507

3550 /*
3551  * get_schema_trigger_objects() - Work function for find_event_triggers
3552  * return: error code
3553  * class(in): class object
3554  * attribute(in): attribute name
3555  * event(in): event type
3556  * active_flag(in): non-zero to check for active status
3557  * object_list(out): trigger object list (returned)
3558  *
3559  * Note:
3560  * Class has already been checked for user ALTER privilege in check_target called from tr_find_event_triggers.
3561  * Locate the trigger list for a particular schema event.
3562  */
3563 static int
3564 get_schema_trigger_objects (DB_OBJECT * class_mop, const char *attribute, DB_TRIGGER_EVENT event, bool active_flag,
3565  DB_OBJLIST ** object_list)
3566 {
3567  TR_SCHEMA_CACHE *cache;
3568  TR_TRIGLIST *t = NULL;
3569  int error = NO_ERROR;
3570 
3571  *object_list = NULL;
3572 
3573  if (sm_get_trigger_cache (class_mop, attribute, 0, (void **) &cache))
3574  {
3575  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
3576  return error;
3577  }
3578 
3579  if (cache == NULL)
3580  {
3581  return NO_ERROR;
3582  }
3583 
3584  if (tr_validate_schema_cache (cache, class_mop))
3585  {
3586  assert (er_errid () != NO_ERROR);
3587  return er_errid ();
3588  }
3589 
3590  if (event == TR_EVENT_ALL)
3591  {
3592  if (!active_flag)
3593  {
3594  /* if we're lucky we can just use the existing object list */
3595  *object_list = ml_ext_copy (cache->objects);
3596  }
3597  else
3598  {
3599  int e;
3600  /* get all active trigger objects */
3601  for (e = 0; e < cache->array_length; e++)
3602  {
3603  for (t = cache->triggers[e]; t && error == NO_ERROR; t = t->next)
3604  {
3605  if (t->trigger->status == TR_STATUS_ACTIVE)
3606  {
3607  error = ml_ext_add (object_list, t->trigger->object, NULL);
3608  }
3609  }
3610  }
3611  }
3612  }
3613  else if (event < cache->array_length)
3614  {
3615  for (t = cache->triggers[event]; t && error == NO_ERROR; t = t->next)
3616  {
3617  if (!active_flag || t->trigger->status == TR_STATUS_ACTIVE)
3618  {
3619  error = ml_ext_add (object_list, t->trigger->object, NULL);
3620  }
3621  }
3622  }
3623 
3624  if (error != NO_ERROR && *object_list != NULL)
3625  {
3626  ml_ext_free (*object_list);
3627  *object_list = NULL;
3628  }
3629 
3630  return error;
3631 }
3632 
3633 /*
3634  * find_event_triggers() - The following function finds all the triggers that have the given event, class, and attribute.
3635  * return: error code
3636  * event(in): event type
3637  * class(in): class object (optional)
3638  * attribute(in): attribute name (optinal)
3639  * active_filter(in): active status flag
3640  * list(out): trigger list (returned)
3641  *
3642  * Note:
3643  *
3644  * The following function finds all the triggers that have the given event, class, and attribute.
3645  * The trigger objects are returned in a moplist "list".
3646  * If there are no triggers with the given event, class, and attribute, the argument list returns NULL.
3647  * NOTE THAT THIS IS NOT AN ERROR (NO ERROR CODE IS SET).
3648  * The combination of trigger event, class, and attribute must have been validated.
3649  * The list needs to be freed using db_objlist_free when it is no longer needed.
3650  * Note that the constructed object list is an "external" object list so that it will be a GC root.
3651  * Note that the function does NOT need to take care of the implication that any event that raises a trigger
3652  * with a target class and a target attribute should also raise every trigger that has the same target class and no
3653  * target attribute. The implication is done in the trigger manager.
3654  */
3655 static int
3656 find_event_triggers (DB_TRIGGER_EVENT event, DB_OBJECT * class_mop, const char *attribute, bool active_filter,
3657  DB_OBJLIST ** list)
3658 {
3659  int error = NO_ERROR;
3660 
3661  *list = NULL;
3662 
3663  if (class_mop == NULL)
3664  {
3665  error = get_user_trigger_objects (event, active_filter, list);
3666  }
3667  else
3668  {
3669  error = get_schema_trigger_objects (class_mop, attribute, event, active_filter, list);
3670  }
3671 
3672  return error;
3673 }
3674 
3675 /* TRIGGER CREATION AND SEMANTIC ANALYSIS */
3676 
3677 /*
3678  * check_target() - This checks to see if the target parameters make sense
3679  * return: non-zero if target is valid
3680  * event(in): trigger event
3681  * class_mop(in): class
3682  * attribute(in): attribute name
3683  *
3684  */
3685 static bool
3686 check_target (DB_TRIGGER_EVENT event, DB_OBJECT * class_mop, const char *attribute)
3687 {
3688  bool status = false;
3689 
3690  /* If this is a class event, the class argument must be supplied */
3691  if (IS_CLASS_EVENT (event))
3692  {
3693  /* class event, at least the class must be specified */
3694  if (class_mop == NULL)
3695  {
3696  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TR_MISSING_TARGET_CLASS, 0);
3697  }
3698  /* User must have ALTER privilege for the class */
3699  else if (au_check_authorization (class_mop, AU_ALTER) == NO_ERROR)
3700  {
3701  if (attribute == NULL)
3702  {
3703  status = true;
3704  }
3705  else
3706  {
3707  /* attribute is only allowed for update events */
3708  if (event != TR_EVENT_UPDATE && event != TR_EVENT_STATEMENT_UPDATE && event != TR_EVENT_ALL)
3709  { /* <-- used in find_event_triggers */
3710  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TR_BAD_TARGET_ATTR, 1, attribute);
3711  }
3712  /* attribute must be defined in the class */
3713  else if (db_get_attribute (class_mop, attribute) != NULL)
3714  {
3715  status = true;
3716  }
3717  }
3718  }
3719  }
3720  else
3721  {
3722  /* not a class event, class and attribute must be unspecified */
3723  if (class_mop != NULL)
3724  {
3725  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TR_BAD_TARGET_CLASS, 1, sm_get_ch_name (class_mop));
3726  }
3727  else if (attribute != NULL)
3728  {
3729  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TR_BAD_TARGET_ATTR, 1, attribute);
3730  }
3731  else
3732  {
3733  status = true;
3734  }
3735  }
3736 
3737  return status;
3738 }
3739 
3740 /*
3741  * check_semantics() - This function checks the validity of a trigger structure about to be installed.
3742  * return: error code
3743  * trigger(in): proposed trigger structure
3744  *
3745  */
3746 static int
3747 check_semantics (TR_TRIGGER * trigger)
3748 {
3749  int error;
3750  DB_OBJECT *object;
3751  TR_ACTIVITY *condition, *action;
3752  const char *c_time, *a_time;
3753 
3754  /* See if the trigger already exists. */
3755  error = trigger_table_find (trigger->name, &object);
3756  if (error != NO_ERROR)
3757  {
3758  return error;
3759  }
3760 
3761  if (object != NULL)
3762  {
3763  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TR_TRIGGER_EXISTS, 1, trigger->name);
3764  return er_errid ();
3765  }
3766 
3767  /* Priority must be non-negative. */
3768  if (trigger->priority < 0)
3769  {
3770  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TR_INVALID_PRIORITY, 0);
3771  return er_errid ();
3772  }
3773 
3774  /* Check event for usable trigger events */
3775  if (trigger->event == TR_EVENT_NULL || trigger->event == TR_EVENT_ALL)
3776  {
3777  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TR_INVALID_EVENT, 0);
3778  return er_errid ();
3779  }
3780 
3781  /* Check target class, attribute, and authorization. */
3782  if (!check_target (trigger->event, trigger->class_mop, trigger->attribute))
3783  {
3784  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
3785  return error;
3786  }
3787 
3788  /*
3789  * CONDITION
3790  * Should compile if necessary.
3791  */
3792  condition = trigger->condition;
3793  if (condition != NULL && condition->type != TR_ACT_NULL)
3794  {
3795  /* Must be an expression suitable for EVALUATE */
3796  if (condition->type != TR_ACT_EXPRESSION)
3797  {
3798  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TR_INVALID_CONDITION_TYPE, 0);
3799  return er_errid ();
3800  }
3801 
3802  /* Formerly, we checked here to make sure that there was no subquery in the search condition.
3803  * Not sure how to detect this, we may just want to make this a supported but "not recommended" option
3804  */
3805  }
3806 
3807  /*
3808  * ACTION
3809  * Should compile if necessary
3810  */
3811  action = trigger->action;
3812  if (action != NULL)
3813  {
3814  /* REJECT actions cannot be AFTER or DEFERRED */
3815  if (action->type == TR_ACT_REJECT && (action->time == TR_TIME_AFTER || action->time == TR_TIME_DEFERRED))
3816  {
3817  /*
3818  * REJECT action cannot be used with an action time of
3819  * AFTER or DEFERRED
3820  */
3821  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TR_REJECT_AFTER_EVENT, 0);
3822  return er_errid ();
3823  }
3824 
3825  /* REJECT actions cannot be applied to TIMEOUT or ABORT events */
3826  if (action->type == TR_ACT_REJECT && (trigger->event == TR_EVENT_ABORT || trigger->event == TR_EVENT_TIMEOUT))
3827  {
3828  /* REJECT action cannot be used with the ABORT or TIMEOUT events */
3829  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TR_REJECT_NOT_POSSIBLE, 0);
3830  return er_errid ();
3831  }
3832 
3833  /* INVALIDATE TRANSACTION events cannot be DEFERRED Why not?? */
3834 #if 0
3835  if (action->type == TR_ACT_INVALIDATE && action->time == TR_TIME_DEFERRED)
3836  {
3837  /* INVALIDATE TRANCACTION action cannot be DEFERRED */
3838  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TR_INVALIDATE_DEFERRED, 0);
3839  return er_errid ();
3840  }
3841 #endif /* 0 */
3842 
3843  /*
3844  * Formerly tested to allow only CALL statements in the action.
3845  * Others might be useful but "not recommended" since the side effects
3846  * of the statement might effect the behavior of the trigger.
3847  */
3848  }
3849 
3850  /*
3851  * TIME
3852  * action time must be greater or equal to condition time
3853  */
3854  if (trigger->condition != NULL && trigger->action != NULL && trigger->action->time < trigger->condition->time)
3855  {
3856  c_time = time_as_string (trigger->condition->time);
3857  a_time = time_as_string (trigger->action->time);
3858  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TR_INVALID_ACTION_TIME, 2, c_time, a_time);
3859  return er_errid ();
3860  }
3861 
3862  return NO_ERROR;
3863 }
3864 
3865 /*
3866  * tr_check_correlation() - Trigger semantics disallow the use of "new" in a before insert trigger to reference the OID of
3867  * the (yet to be) inserted instance. So, we must walk the statement searching for this special case
3868  * return: the node
3869  * parser(in): the parser context
3870  * node(in): the activity statement
3871  * arg(in): unused
3872  * walk_on(in): controls traversal
3873  *
3874  */
3875 static PT_NODE *
3876 tr_check_correlation (PARSER_CONTEXT * parser, PT_NODE * node, void *arg, int *walk_on)
3877 {
3878 
3879  /*
3880  * If we have a name node, then we already know it's a before insert
3881  * trigger, so check to see if the resolved name is "new".
3882  * If so, and there is no original, the it must be "new" and not "new.a".
3883  */
3884  /* TODO: char *info.name.original; compare with NULL?? */
3885  if (node->node_type == PT_NAME && node->info.name.resolved && node->info.name.original
3886  && (node->info.name.original == NULL) && !strcmp (node->info.name.resolved, NEW_REFERENCE_NAME))
3887  {
3888  PT_ERROR (parser, node, er_msg ());
3889  }
3890 
3891  return node;
3892 }
3893 
3894 /*
3895  * tr_create_trigger() - Primary interface function for defining a trigger
3896  * return: trigger object (persistent database object)
3897  * name(in): unique name
3898  * status(in): active/inactive
3899  * priority(in): relative priority (default is 0.0)
3900  * event(in): event type
3901  * class(in): target class
3902  * attribute(in): target attribute name
3903  * cond_time(in): condition time
3904  * cond_source(in): condition source string
3905  * action_time(in): action time
3906  * action_type(in): action type
3907  * action_source(in): action expression source
3908  * comment(in): trigger comment
3909  *
3910  * Note:
3911  * Errors: ER_TR_TRIGGER_EXISTS:
3912  * ER_TR_INVALIDE_PRIORITY:
3913  * ER_TR_MISSING_TARGET_CLASS:
3914  * ER_AU_ALTER_FAILURE:
3915  * ER_SM_ATTRIBUTE_NOT_FOUND:
3916  * ER_TR_INCONSISTENT_TARGET:
3917  * ER_TR_INVALID_ACTION_TIME:
3918  * ER_TR_INVALID_CONDITION:
3919  * ER_TR_INVALID_ACTION:
3920  * ER_TR_INVALID_EVENT:
3921  */
3922 DB_OBJECT *
3923 tr_create_trigger (const char *name, DB_TRIGGER_STATUS status, double priority, DB_TRIGGER_EVENT event,
3924  DB_OBJECT * class_mop, const char *attribute, DB_TRIGGER_TIME cond_time, const char *cond_source,
3925  DB_TRIGGER_TIME action_time, DB_TRIGGER_ACTION action_type, const char *action_source,
3926  const char *comment)
3927 {
3928  TR_TRIGGER *trigger;
3929  DB_OBJECT *object;
3930  char realname[SM_MAX_IDENTIFIER_LENGTH];
3931  bool tr_object_map_added = false;
3932  bool has_savepoint = false;
3933 
3934  object = NULL;
3935 
3936  trigger = tr_make_trigger ();
3937  if (trigger == NULL)
3938  {
3939  return NULL;
3940  }
3941 
3942  /* Initialize a trigger */
3943  trigger->owner = Au_user;
3944  trigger->status = status;
3945  trigger->priority = priority;
3946  trigger->event = event;
3947  trigger->class_mop = class_mop;
3948  trigger->comment = (comment == NULL) ? NULL : strdup (comment);
3949 
3950  if (class_mop != NULL)
3951  {
3952  int is_vclass = db_is_vclass (class_mop);
3953 
3954  if (is_vclass < 0)
3955  {
3956  goto error;
3957  }
3958  if (is_vclass)
3959  {
3960  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TR_NO_VCLASSES, 1, db_get_class_name (class_mop));
3961  goto error;
3962  }
3963  }
3964 
3965  trigger->name = tr_process_name (name);
3966  if (trigger->name == NULL)
3967  {
3968  goto error;
3969  }
3970 
3971  if (attribute != NULL)
3972  {
3973  sm_downcase_name (attribute, realname, SM_MAX_IDENTIFIER_LENGTH);
3974  trigger->attribute = strdup (realname);
3975  }
3976  else
3977  {
3978  trigger->attribute = NULL;
3979  }
3980 
3981  if (attribute != NULL && trigger->attribute == NULL)
3982  {
3983  goto error;
3984  }
3985 
3986  /* build the condition */
3987  if (cond_source != NULL)
3988  {
3989  trigger->condition = make_activity ();
3990  if (trigger->condition == NULL)
3991  {
3992  goto error;
3993  }
3994 
3995  trigger->condition->type = TR_ACT_EXPRESSION;
3996  trigger->condition->source = strdup (cond_source);
3997  if (trigger->condition->source == NULL)
3998  {
3999  goto error;
4000  }
4001 
4002  if (cond_time != TR_TIME_NULL)
4003  {
4004  trigger->condition->time = cond_time;
4005  }
4006  else if (action_time != TR_TIME_NULL)
4007  {
4008  trigger->condition->time = action_time;
4009  }
4010  else
4011  {
4012  trigger->condition->time = TR_TIME_AFTER;
4013  }
4014  }
4015 
4016  /* build the action */
4017  if (action_type != TR_ACT_NULL)
4018  {
4019  if (action_type == TR_ACT_EXPRESSION && action_source == NULL)
4020  {
4021  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TR_MISSING_ACTION_STRING, 0);
4022  goto error;
4023  }
4024 
4025  trigger->action = make_activity ();
4026  if (trigger->action == NULL)
4027  {
4028  goto error;
4029  }
4030 
4031  trigger->action->type = action_type;
4032  if (action_source != NULL)
4033  {
4034  trigger->action->source = strdup (action_source);
4035  if (trigger->action->source == NULL)
4036  {
4037  goto error;
4038  }
4039  }
4040 
4041  if (action_time != TR_TIME_NULL)
4042  {
4043  trigger->action->time = action_time;
4044  }
4045  else if (cond_time != TR_TIME_NULL)
4046  {
4047  trigger->action->time = cond_time;
4048  }
4049  else
4050  {
4051  trigger->action->time = TR_TIME_AFTER;
4052  }
4053  }
4054 
4055  /* make sure everything looks ok */
4056  if (check_semantics (trigger))
4057  {
4058  goto error;
4059  }
4060 
4061  /* be sure that the condition and action expressions can be compiled */
4062  if (trigger->condition != NULL && compile_trigger_activity (trigger, trigger->condition, 1))
4063  {
4064  goto error;
4065  }
4066 
4067  if (trigger->action != NULL && compile_trigger_activity (trigger, trigger->action, 0))
4068  {
4069  goto error;
4070  }
4071 
4072  if (TM_TRAN_ISOLATION () >= TRAN_REP_READ)
4073  {
4074  /* protect against multiple flushes to server */
4075  if (tran_system_savepoint (UNIQUE_SAVEPOINT_CREATE_TRIGGER) != NO_ERROR)
4076  {
4077  goto error;
4078  }
4079 
4080  has_savepoint = true;
4081  }
4082 
4083  /* from here down, the unwinding when errors are encountered gets rather complex */
4084 
4085  /* convert to a persistent instance */
4086  object = trigger_to_object (trigger);
4087  if (object == NULL)
4088  {
4089  goto error;
4090  }
4091 
4092  /* put it on the "new" trigger list */
4093  if (insert_trigger_list (&tr_Uncommitted_triggers, trigger))
4094  {
4095  /*
4096  * we could't delete the trigger objects we just created ?
4097  * db_drop(object);
4098  */
4099  goto error;
4100  }
4101 
4102  /* add to global name table */
4103  if (trigger_table_add (trigger->name, object))
4104  {
4105  goto error;
4106  }
4107 
4108  /*
4109  * add to object map table, could check for trigger already at this
4110  * location but since this is a new MOP that "can't" happen
4111  */
4112  if (mht_put (tr_object_map, object, trigger) == NULL)
4113  {
4114  goto error;
4115  }
4116 
4117  tr_object_map_added = true;
4118 
4119  /* cache the trigger in the the schema or the user object for later reference */
4120  if (trigger->class_mop != NULL)
4121  {
4122  if (sm_add_trigger (trigger->class_mop, trigger->attribute, 0, trigger->object))
4123  {
4124  goto error;
4125  }
4126  }
4127  else
4128  {
4129  if (register_user_trigger (object))
4130  {
4131  goto error;
4132  }
4133  }
4134 
4135  if (TM_TRAN_ISOLATION () >= TRAN_REP_READ)
4136  {
4137  /* need to flush in isolation level >= RR, since in case of serializable conflict we have to abort the current
4138  * command */
4139  if (locator_all_flush () != NO_ERROR)
4140  {
4141  goto error;
4142  }
4143  }
4144 
4145  return object;
4146 
4147 error:
4148 
4149  if (trigger != NULL)
4150  {
4151  if (object != NULL)
4152  {
4153  if (tr_object_map_added)
4154  {
4155  (void) mht_rem (tr_object_map, trigger->object, NULL, NULL);
4156  }
4157 
4158  (void) trigger_table_drop (trigger->name);
4159  }
4160  remove_trigger_list (&tr_Uncommitted_triggers, trigger);
4161  tr_drop_deferred_activities (trigger->object, NULL);
4162  free_trigger (trigger);
4163  }
4164 
4165  if (has_savepoint && er_errid () != ER_LK_UNILATERALLY_ABORTED)
4166  {
4167  (void) tran_abort_upto_system_savepoint (UNIQUE_SAVEPOINT_CREATE_TRIGGER);
4168  }
4169 
4170  return NULL;
4171 }

4176 /*
4177  * These functions locate triggers and return trigger instances.
4178  *
4179  */
4180 
4181 /*
4182  * tr_find_all_triggers() - This function returns a list of object pointers
4183  * return: error code
4184  * list(out): pointer to the return trigger object list
4185  *
4186  * Note:
4187  * The return list contains every user trigger owned by the user, and every class trigger such that the user has
4188  * the SELECT privilege for the class in its event target. The return object pointer list
4189  * must be freed using db_objlist_free it is no longer needed.
4190  *
4191  */
4192 int
4193 tr_find_all_triggers (DB_OBJLIST ** list)
4194 {
4195  int error;
4196  int save;
4197 
4198  AU_DISABLE (save);
4199 
4200  error = find_all_triggers (false, false, list);
4201 
4202  AU_ENABLE (save);
4203  return error;
4204 }
4205 
4206 /*
4207  * tr_find_trigger() - This function returns the object pointer of the trigger with the input name.
4208  * return: DB_OBJECT
4209  * name(in): trigger name
4210  * Note :
4211  * If no existing trigger has the name, or the user does not have the access privilege of the trigger, NULL
4212  * will be returned. If NULL is returned, the system will set the global error status indicating
4213  * the exact nature of the error.
4214  *
4215  * Errors:
4216  * ER_TR_TRIGGER_NOT_FOUND: A trigger with the specified name could not be located.
4217  * ER_TR_TRIGGER_SELECT_FAILURE: The trigger is a user trigger that does not belong to the user.
4218  * ER_AU_SELECT_FAILURE: The user does not have the SELECT privilege for the target class
4219  * of the specified target (the trigger must be a class trigger).
4220  *
4221  */
4222 DB_OBJECT *
4223 tr_find_trigger (const char *name)
4224 {
4225  DB_OBJECT *object;
4226  TR_TRIGGER *trigger;
4227  int save;
4228 
4229  object = NULL;
4230  AU_DISABLE (save);
4231 
4232  if (trigger_table_find (name, &object) == NO_ERROR)
4233  {
4234  if (object == NULL)
4235  {
4236  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TR_TRIGGER_NOT_FOUND, 1, name);
4237  }
4238  else
4239  {
4240  trigger = tr_map_trigger (object, 1);
4241  if (trigger == NULL)
4242  {
4243  object = NULL;
4244  }
4245  else
4246  {
4247  if (!check_authorization (trigger, 0))
4248  {
4249  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TR_TRIGGER_SELECT_FAILURE, 1, name);
4250  object = NULL;
4251  }
4252  }
4253  }
4254  }
4255 
4256  AU_ENABLE (save);
4257  return object;
4258 }
4259 
4260 /*
4261  * tr_find_event_triggers() - Locate all triggers that are defined for a particular event
4262  * return: int
4263  * event(in): event type
4264  * class_mop(in): target class
4265  * attribute(in): target attribute
4266  * active(in): flag to retrieve active status triggers only
4267  * list(out): pointer to the return list of object pointers
4268  *
4269  */
4270 int
4271 tr_find_event_triggers (DB_TRIGGER_EVENT event, DB_OBJECT * class_mop, const char *attribute, bool active,
4272  DB_OBJLIST ** list)
4273 {
4274  int error = NO_ERROR;
4275  int save;
4276 
4277  AU_DISABLE (save);
4278 
4279  /* check for sensible parameters and ALTER authorization for class */
4280  if (!check_target (event, class_mop, attribute))
4281  {
4282  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
4283  }
4284  else
4285  {
4286  error = find_event_triggers (event, class_mop, attribute, active, list);
4287  }
4288 
4289  AU_ENABLE (save);
4290  return error;
4291 }
4292 
4293 /*
4294  * tr_check_authorization() - This is used to see if a particular authorization is enabled for a trigger object
4295  * return: error code
4296  * trigger_object(in): trigger object
4297  * alter_flag(in): non-zero if needing alter authorization
4298  *
4299  * Note:
4300  * This is used to see if a particular authorization is enabled for a trigger object.
4301  * It is intended to be called by do_trigger to make sure that statement operations involving multiple triggers
4302  * can be performed without authorization errors.
4303  * Since trigger objects are individually authorized, we can't use db_check_authorization because the db_trigger class
4304  * is normally completely protected.
4305  * If the alter-flag is zero, we just check for basic read authorization
4306  * if the flag is non-zero, we also check for ALTER authorization on the associated class.
4307  */
4308 int
4309 tr_check_authorization (DB_OBJECT * trigger_object, int alter_flag)
4310 {
4311  int error = NO_ERROR;
4312  TR_TRIGGER *trigger;
4313  int save;
4314 
4315  AU_DISABLE (save);
4316 
4317  trigger = tr_map_trigger (trigger_object, 1);
4318 
4319  if (trigger == NULL)
4320  {
4321  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
4322  }
4323  else
4324  {
4325  if (!check_authorization (trigger, alter_flag))
4326  {
4327  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
4328  }
4329  }
4330 
4331  AU_ENABLE (save);
4332  return error;
4333 }
4334 
4335 /* TRIGGER REMOVAL */
4336 
4337 /*
4338  * tr_drop_trigger_internal() - This is a work function for tr_drop_trigger and is also called by tr_check_rollback_event
4339  * to get rid of triggers created during the current transaction
4340  * return: error code
4341  * trigger(in): trigger cache structure
4342  * rollback(in):
4343  *
4344  * Note:
4345  * It removes the trigger from the various structures it may be attached to and deletes it.
4346  * If this is part of the rollback operation, we're more tolerant of errors since this operation has to be
4347  * performed regardless.
4348  * ROLLBACK NOTES:
4349  * It probably isn't necessary that we remove things from the schema cache because the class will have been marked
4350  * dirty and will be re-loaded with the old trigger state during the next transaction.
4351  * The main thing this does is remove the object from the trigger mapping table.
4352  *
4353  */
4354 static int
4355 tr_drop_trigger_internal (TR_TRIGGER * trigger, int rollback, bool need_savepoint)
4356 {
4357  int error = NO_ERROR;
4358  int save;
4359  bool has_savepoint = false;
4360 
4361  if (need_savepoint)
4362  {
4363  /* protect against multiple flushes to server */
4364  error = tran_system_savepoint (UNIQUE_SAVEPOINT_DROP_TRIGGER);
4365  if (error != NO_ERROR)
4366  {
4367  return error;
4368  }
4369 
4370  has_savepoint = true;
4371  }
4372 
4373  AU_DISABLE (save);
4374 
4375  /* remove it from the class or user cache */
4376  if (trigger->class_mop == NULL)
4377  {
4378  error = unregister_user_trigger (trigger, rollback);
4379  }
4380  else
4381  {
4382  error = sm_drop_trigger (trigger->class_mop, trigger->attribute, 0, trigger->object);
4383  /* if the class has been deleted, just ignore the error */
4384  if (error == ER_HEAP_UNKNOWN_OBJECT)
4385  {
4386  error = NO_ERROR;
4387  }
4388  }
4389 
4390  if (error == NO_ERROR || rollback)
4391  {
4392  /* remove it from the uncommitted trigger list (if its on there) */
4393  remove_trigger_list (&tr_Uncommitted_triggers, trigger);
4394 
4395  /* remove it from the memory cache */
4396  error = tr_unmap_trigger (trigger);
4397 
4398  if (error == NO_ERROR || rollback)
4399  {
4400  /* remove it from the global name table */
4401  error = trigger_table_drop (trigger->name);
4402 
4403  if (error == NO_ERROR && !rollback)
4404  {
4405  /*
4406  * if this isn't a rollback, delete the object, otherwise
4407  * it will already be marked as deleted as part of the normal transaction cleanup
4408  */
4409  db_drop (trigger->object);
4410 
4411  /*
4412  * flush, decache object; no need to check if the object was indeed deleted;
4413  * it is supposed that the last version of the object was locked and deleted
4414  * because only the last version can be locked; previous versions are in the log
4415  */
4416  error = locator_flush_instance (trigger->object);
4417  if (error == NO_ERROR)
4418  {
4419  ws_decache (trigger->object);
4420  ws_clear_hints (trigger->object, false);
4421  }
4422  }
4423 
4424  /* free the cache structure */
4425  free_trigger (trigger);
4426  }
4427  }
4428 
4429  AU_ENABLE (save);
4430 
4431  if (need_savepoint && error != NO_ERROR && error != ER_LK_UNILATERALLY_ABORTED)
4432  {
4433  (void) tran_abort_upto_system_savepoint (UNIQUE_SAVEPOINT_DROP_TRIGGER);
4434  }
4435 
4436  return error;
4437 }
4438 
4439 /*
4440  * tr_drop_trigger() - Removes a trigger from the system.
4441  * return: error
4442  * obj(in): trigger object
4443  * call_from_api(in): call from api flag
4444  *
4445  * Note:
4446  * We still check to make sure the active user is the owner of the trigger before proceeding.
4447  */
4448 int
4449 tr_drop_trigger (DB_OBJECT * obj, bool call_from_api)
4450 {
4451  int error = NO_ERROR;
4452  TR_TRIGGER *trigger;
4453  char *trigger_name = NULL;
4454  int save;
4455 
4456  /* Do we need to disable authorization just for check_authorization ? */
4457  AU_DISABLE (save);
4458 
4459  /*
4460  * Turn off the "fetch" flag to tr_map_trigger so we don't attempt to validate the trigger by compiling
4461  * the statements, etc. As we're going to delete it, we don't care if the trigger is valid or not.
4462  * In particular this is necessary if any of the triggers referenced classes have been deleted
4463  * because the validation will fail tr_map_trigger would return an error.
4464  */
4465 
4466  trigger = tr_map_trigger (obj, false);
4467  if (trigger == NULL)
4468  {
4469  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
4470  }
4471  else
4472  {
4473  trigger_name = strdup (trigger->name);
4474  }
4475 
4476  if (trigger == NULL)
4477  {
4478  ;
4479  }
4480  else if (!check_authorization (trigger, true))
4481  {
4482  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TR_TRIGGER_DELETE_FAILURE, 1, trigger->name);
4483  error = er_errid ();
4484  }
4485  else
4486  {
4487  if ((trigger->condition && trigger->condition->time == TR_TIME_DEFERRED)
4488  || (trigger->action && trigger->action->time == TR_TIME_DEFERRED))
4489  {
4490  error = tr_drop_deferred_activities (obj, NULL);
4491  }
4492 
4493  if (error == NO_ERROR)
4494  {
4495  bool need_savepoint = (TM_TRAN_ISOLATION () >= TRAN_REP_READ);
4496 
4497  error = tr_drop_trigger_internal (trigger, 0, need_savepoint);
4498  }
4499  }
4500 
4501  AU_ENABLE (save);
4502 
4503  if (trigger_name)
4504  {
4505  free_and_init (trigger_name);
4506  }
4507 
4508  return error;
4509 }
4510 
4511 /* CONDITION & ACTION EVALUATION */
4512 
4513 /*
4514  * value_as_boolean() - This maps a value container into a boolean value.
4515  * return: boolean (zero or non-zero)
4516  * value(in): standard value container
4517  *
4518  * Note:
4519  * It is intended to be used where condition expressions can return any value but the result must be treated as a boolean.
4520  * The status will be false if the value contains one of the numeric types whose value is zero.
4521  * The status will also be false if the value is of type DB_TYPE_NULL. For all other data types, the status will be true.
4522  * NOTE: This means that an empty string will be true as will sets with no elements.
4523  */
4524 static bool
4525 value_as_boolean (DB_VALUE * value)
4526 {
4527  bool status = true;
4528 
4529  switch (DB_VALUE_TYPE (value))
4530  {
4531  case DB_TYPE_NULL:
4532  status = false;
4533  break;
4534  case DB_TYPE_SHORT:
4535  status = (db_get_short (value) == 0) ? false : true;
4536  break;
4537  case DB_TYPE_INTEGER:
4538  status = (db_get_int (value) == 0) ? false : true;
4539  break;
4540  case DB_TYPE_BIGINT:
4541  status = (db_get_bigint (value) == 0) ? false : true;
4542  break;
4543  case DB_TYPE_FLOAT:
4544  status = (db_get_float (value) == 0) ? false : true;
4545  break;
4546  case DB_TYPE_DOUBLE:
4547  status = (db_get_double (value) == 0) ? false : true;
4548  break;
4549  case DB_TYPE_TIME:
4550  status = (*db_get_time (value) == 0) ? false : true;
4551  break;
4552  case DB_TYPE_TIMESTAMP:
4553  case DB_TYPE_TIMESTAMPLTZ:
4554  status = (*db_get_timestamp (value) == 0) ? false : true;
4555  break;
4556  case DB_TYPE_TIMESTAMPTZ:
4557  {
4558  DB_TIMESTAMPTZ *ts_tz = db_get_timestamptz (value);
4559 
4560  status = (ts_tz->timestamp == 0) ? false : true;
4561  }
4562  break;
4563  case DB_TYPE_DATETIME:
4564  case DB_TYPE_DATETIMELTZ:
4565  status = (db_get_datetime (value)->date == 0 && db_get_datetime (value)->time == 0) ? false : true;
4566  break;
4567  case DB_TYPE_DATETIMETZ:
4568  {
4569  DB_DATETIMETZ *dt_tz = db_get_datetimetz (value);
4570 
4571  status = (dt_tz->datetime.date == 0 && dt_tz->datetime.time == 0) ? false : true;
4572  }
4573  break;
4574  case DB_TYPE_DATE:
4575  status = (*db_get_date (value) == 0) ? false : true;
4576  break;
4577  case DB_TYPE_MONETARY:
4578  status = (db_get_monetary (value)->amount == 0) ? false : true;
4579  break;
4580 
4581  default:
4582  status = true;
4583  }
4584 
4585  return status;
4586 }
4587 
4588 /*
4589  * signal_evaluation_error() - This is called when a trigger condition or action could not be evaluated.
4590  * return: error code
4591  * trigger(in): trigger of interest
4592  * error(in):
4593  *
4594  * Note:
4595  * We take whatever the last error was set by the parser and package it up into an error that contains the name
4596  * of the trigger so we have some context to determine what went wrong. This is especially if the error happens
4597  * during the evaluation of a deferred trigger at commit time.
4598  * Note that since the error text is kept in a static buffer, we can't pass it to er_set() without corrupting things.
4599  * Must copy it into a temp buffer.
4600  */
4601 static int
4602 signal_evaluation_error (TR_TRIGGER * trigger, int error)
4603 {
4604  char buffer[MAX_ERROR_STRING];
4605  const char *msg;
4606 
4607  /*
4608  * if we've already set this error, don't do it again, this is for recursive triggers so we don't keep tacking
4609  * on the name 'n' times for each level of call
4610  */
4611  if (er_errid () != error && er_errid () != ER_LK_UNILATERALLY_ABORTED && er_errid () != ER_MVCC_SERIALIZABLE_CONFLICT)
4612  {
4613  msg = er_msg ();
4614  if (msg == NULL)
4615  {
4616  strcpy (buffer, "");
4617  }
4618  else
4619  {
4620  strncpy (buffer, msg, sizeof (buffer) - 1);
4621  buffer[MAX_ERROR_STRING - 1] = '\0';
4622  }
4623 
4624  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 2, trigger->name, buffer);
4625  }
4626 
4627  return error;
4628 }
4629 
4630 /*
4631  * eval_condition() - The function evaluates the input trigger condition.
4632  * return: TR_RETURN_ERROR/TR_RETURN_TRUE/TR_RETURN_FALSE
4633  * trigger(in):
4634  * current(in):
4635  * temp(in):
4636  * status(in):
4637  *
4638  */
4639 static int
4640 eval_condition (TR_TRIGGER * trigger, DB_OBJECT * current, DB_OBJECT * temp, bool * status)
4641 {
4642  int error = NO_ERROR;
4643  TR_ACTIVITY *act;
4644  DB_VALUE value;
4645  int pt_status;
4646 
4647  act = trigger->condition;
4648  if (act == NULL)
4649  {
4650  return NO_ERROR;
4651  }
4652 
4653  if (tr_Trace)
4654  {
4655  fprintf (stdout, "TRACE: Evaluating condition for trigger \"%s\".\n", trigger->name);
4656  }
4657 
4658  if (act->type != TR_ACT_EXPRESSION)
4659  {
4660  /* this should have been checked by now */
4661  error = ER_TR_INVALID_CONDITION_TYPE;
4662  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 0);
4663  }
4664  else
4665  {
4666  /* should have been done by now */
4667  if (tr_Current_depth <= 1 && ++act->exec_cnt > prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_RESET_TR_PARSER)
4668  && prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_RESET_TR_PARSER) > 0)
4669  {
4670  if (act->parser != NULL)
4671  {
4672  parser_free_parser ((PARSER_CONTEXT *) act->parser);
4673  act->parser = NULL;
4674  }
4675  act->exec_cnt = 0;
4676  }
4677 
4678  if (act->parser == NULL)
4679  {
4680  error = compile_trigger_activity (trigger, act, 1);
4681  }
4682 
4683  if (error == NO_ERROR)
4684  {
4685  if (act->parser == NULL || act->statement == NULL)
4686  {
4687  /* shouldn't happen */
4688  error = ER_TR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
4689  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 1, trigger->name);
4690  }
4691  else
4692  {
4693  if (current == NULL)
4694  {
4695  current = temp;
4696  temp = NULL;
4697  }
4698 
4699  pt_status = pt_exec_trigger_stmt ((PARSER_CONTEXT *) act->parser, (PT_NODE *) act->statement, current,
4700  temp, &value);
4701  /*
4702  * recall that pt_exec_trigger_stmt can return a positive
4703  * value for success, errors must be checked against negative
4704  */
4705  if (pt_status < 0)
4706  {
4707  error = signal_evaluation_error (trigger, ER_TR_CONDITION_EVAL);
4708  }
4709  else
4710  {
4711  *status = value_as_boolean (&value);
4712  }
4713 
4714  /*
4715  * kludage, until we figure out how to reuse the same
4716  * parser over and over, we have to throw away the
4717  * copmiled expression and do it again the next time
4718  */
4719 #if 0
4720  parser_free_parser (act->parser);
4721  act->parser = NULL;
4722  act->statement = NULL;
4723 #endif /* 0 */
4724 
4725  }
4726  }
4727  }
4728 
4729  return error;
4730 }
4731 
4732 /*
4733  * tr_check_recursivity() - Analyze the trigger stack and detect if the given trigger has occured earlier: this is a way
4734  * to detect recursive trigger chains at runtime.
4735  * return: TR_DECISION_CONTINUE - no recursion found
4736  * TR_DECISION_HALT_WITH_ERROR - found recursive triggers
4737  * TR_DECISION_DO_NOT_CONTINUE - found recursive STATEMENT trigger
4738  * oid (in): OID of trigger to analyze
4739  * stack(in): array of stack_size OIDs of the calling triggers
4740  * stack_size(in):
4741  * is_statement(in): if the current trigger is a STATEMENT one and it turns out it is recursive,
4742  * ignore it silently, with no error
4743  */
4744 static TR_RECURSION_DECISION
4745 tr_check_recursivity (OID oid, OID stack[], int stack_size, bool is_statement)
4746 {
4747  int i, min;
4748 
4749  assert (stack);
4750  assert (stack_size < TR_MAX_RECURSION_LEVEL);
4751 
4752  /* we allow recursive triggers, if they are not STATEMENT triggers */
4753  if (!is_statement)
4754  {
4755  return TR_DECISION_CONTINUE;
4756  }
4757 
4758  min = MIN (stack_size, TR_MAX_RECURSION_LEVEL);
4759  for (i = 0; i < min; i++)
4760  {
4761  if (oid_compare (&oid, &stack[i]) == 0)
4762  {
4763  /* this is a STATEMENT trigger, we should not go further with the action, but we should allow the call to
4764  * succeed.
4765  */
4766  return TR_DECISION_DO_NOT_CONTINUE;
4767  }
4768  }
4769 
4770  return TR_DECISION_CONTINUE;
4771 }
4772 
4773 /*
4774  * eval_action() - The function evaluates the input trigger action.
4775  * return: int
4776  * trigger(in):
4777  * current(in):
4778  * temp(in):
4779  * reject(in):
4780  *
4781  */
4782 static int
4783 eval_action (TR_TRIGGER * trigger, DB_OBJECT * current, DB_OBJECT * temp, bool * reject)
4784 {
4785  int error = NO_ERROR;
4786  TR_ACTIVITY *act;
4787  DB_VALUE value;
4788  int pt_status;
4789  OID oid_of_trigger;
4790  TR_RECURSION_DECISION dec;
4791  bool is_statement = false;
4792  bool used_cached_statement = true;
4793 
4794  if (trigger->object)
4795  {
4796  oid_of_trigger = trigger->object->oid_info.oid;
4797  }
4798  else
4799  {
4800  error = ER_TR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
4801  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 1, trigger->name);
4802  return error;
4803  }
4804 
4805  assert (0 < tr_Current_depth);
4806 
4807  /* If this is NOT a statement trigger, we just continue through. Recursive triggers will step past the max depth and
4808  * will be rejected. STATEMENT triggers, on the other side, should be fired only once. This is why we keep the OID
4809  * stack and we check it if we have a STATEMENT trig.
4810  */
4811  is_statement = (trigger->event == TR_EVENT_STATEMENT_DELETE || trigger->event == TR_EVENT_STATEMENT_INSERT
4812  || trigger->event == TR_EVENT_STATEMENT_UPDATE);
4813 
4814  if (is_statement)
4815  {
4816  dec = tr_check_recursivity (oid_of_trigger, tr_Stack, tr_Current_depth - 1, is_statement);
4817  switch (dec)
4818  {
4819  case TR_DECISION_HALT_WITH_ERROR:
4820  error = ER_TR_EXCEEDS_MAX_REC_LEVEL;
4821  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 2, tr_Current_depth, trigger->name);
4822  return error;
4823 
4824  case TR_DECISION_DO_NOT_CONTINUE:
4825  return NO_ERROR;
4826 
4827  case TR_DECISION_CONTINUE:
4828  break;
4829  }
4830  }
4831 
4832  if (tr_Current_depth <= TR_MAX_RECURSION_LEVEL)
4833  {
4834  tr_Stack[tr_Current_depth - 1] = oid_of_trigger;
4835  }
4836  else
4837  {
4838  assert (false);
4839  }
4840 
4841  act = trigger->action;
4842  if (act != NULL)
4843  {
4844  if (tr_Trace)
4845  {
4846  fprintf (stdout, "TRACE: Executing action for trigger \"%s\".\n", trigger->name);
4847  }
4848 
4849  switch (act->type)
4850  {
4851  case TR_ACT_REJECT:
4852  *reject = true;
4853  break;
4854 
4855  case TR_ACT_INVALIDATE:
4856  tr_Invalid_transaction = true;
4857  /* remember the name for the error message */
4858  strncpy (tr_Invalid_transaction_trigger, trigger->name, sizeof (tr_Invalid_transaction_trigger) - 1);
4859  break;
4860 
4861  case TR_ACT_PRINT:
4862  if (trigger->action->source != NULL)
4863  {
4864  fprintf (stdout, "%s\n", trigger->action->source);
4865  }
4866  break;
4867 
4868  case TR_ACT_EXPRESSION:
4869  compile_stmt_again:
4870  if (tr_Current_depth <= 1 && ++act->exec_cnt > prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_RESET_TR_PARSER)
4871  && prm_get_integer_value (PRM_ID_RESET_TR_PARSER) > 0)
4872  {
4873  if (act->parser != NULL)
4874  {
4875  parser_free_parser ((PARSER_CONTEXT *) act->parser);
4876  act->parser = NULL;
4877  }
4878  act->exec_cnt = 0;
4879  }
4880  if (act->parser == NULL)
4881  {
4882  error = compile_trigger_activity (trigger, act, 0);
4883  used_cached_statement = false;
4884  }
4885 
4886  if (error != NO_ERROR)
4887  {
4888  break;
4889  }
4890 
4891  if (act->parser == NULL || act->statement == NULL)
4892  {
4893  /* shouldn't happen */
4894  error = ER_TR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
4895  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 1, trigger->name);
4896  }
4897  else
4898  {
4899  if (current == NULL)
4900  {
4901  current = temp;
4902  temp = NULL;
4903  }
4904 
4905  pt_status =
4906  pt_exec_trigger_stmt ((PARSER_CONTEXT *) act->parser, (PT_NODE *) act->statement, current, temp,
4907  &value);
4908 
4909  /* If using the cached statement and ER_QPROC_INVALID_XASLNODE error returned, It means that the
4910  * act->statement is old or invalid. It should be re-compiled again.
4911  */
4912  if (pt_status == ER_QPROC_INVALID_XASLNODE && used_cached_statement)
4913  {
4914  parser_free_parser ((PARSER_CONTEXT *) act->parser);
4915  act->parser = NULL;
4916  act->statement = NULL;
4917 
4918  er_clear ();
4919  goto compile_stmt_again;
4920  }
4921 
4922  /*
4923  * recall that pt_exec_trigger_stmt can return positive
4924  * values to indicate success, errors must be explicitly
4925  * checked for < 0
4926  */
4927 
4928  if (pt_status < 0)
4929  {
4930  error = signal_evaluation_error (trigger, ER_TR_ACTION_EVAL);
4931  /*
4932  * Reset the error stuff so that we'll try things
4933  * afresh the next time we reuse this parser.
4934  */
4935  pt_reset_error ((PARSER_CONTEXT *) act->parser);
4936  }
4937 
4938  /*
4939  * kludge, until we figure out how to reuse the same
4940  * parser over and over, we have to throw away the
4941  * copmiled expression and do it again the next time
4942  */
4943 #if 0
4944  parser_free_parser (act->parser);
4945  act->parser = NULL;
4946  act->statement = NULL;
4947 #endif /* 0 */
4948  }
4949  break;
4950 
4951  default:
4952  error = ER_TR_INTERNAL_ERROR;
4953  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 1, trigger->name);
4954  break;
4955  }
4956  }
4957 
4958  return error;
4959 }
4960 
4961 /*
4962  * execute_activity() - The function executes the condition or action or condition and action of the trigger according to
4963  * the following rules.
4964  * return: int
4965  * trigger(in): trigger
4966  * tr_time(in): execution time
4967  * current(in):
4968  * temp(in):
4969  * rejected(in):
4970  *
4971  * Note:
4972  * If the execution of the condition is the same as the argument time, the condition will be evaluated.
4973  * If the condition is evaluated as true, or the execution time of the condition is less than the argument time,
4974  * the action will be considered.
4975  * If the action is considered and the execution time of the action is the same as the argument time,
4976  * the action will be executed.
4977  * The function returns TR_RETURN_ERROR if there is an error.
4978  * Otherwise, it returns TR_RETURN_TRUE if the action is executed or does not need to be executed (because of the
4979  * condition), or TR_RETURN_FALSE for the other cases.
4980  * If the action is "REJECT", the argument is_reject_action returns true.
4981  */
4982 static int
4983 execute_activity (TR_TRIGGER * trigger, DB_TRIGGER_TIME tr_time, DB_OBJECT * current, DB_OBJECT * temp, bool * rejected)
4984 {
4985  int rstatus;
4986  bool execute_action;
4987  DB_OBJECT *save_user;
4988 
4989  save_user = NULL;
4990  if (trigger->owner != NULL)
4991  {
4992  save_user = Au_user;
4993  if (AU_SET_USER (trigger->owner))
4994  {
4995  return TR_RETURN_ERROR;
4996  }
4997  }
4998 
4999  rstatus = TR_RETURN_TRUE;
5000  *rejected = false;
5001 
5002  /* assume that we will be removing the trigger by returning true */
5003  execute_action = true;
5004 
5005  /*
5006  * If the trigger isn't active, ignore it. It would be more effecient if the inactive triggers could be filtered from
5007  * the lists as the combined list is built
5008  */
5009  if (trigger->status == TR_STATUS_ACTIVE)
5010  {
5011  if (trigger->condition != NULL)
5012  {
5013  execute_action = false;
5014  if (trigger->condition->time == tr_time)
5015  {
5016  if (eval_condition (trigger, current, temp, &execute_action) != NO_ERROR)
5017  {
5018  rstatus = TR_RETURN_ERROR;
5019  }
5020  }
5021  else if ((int) trigger->condition->time > (int) tr_time)
5022  {
5023  /* activity is to be considered later, return false */
5024  rstatus = TR_RETURN_FALSE;
5025  }
5026 
5027  else
5028  {
5029  /*
5030  * else, the time has passed, only see this if the condition has
5031  * been fired but the action comes later
5032  */
5033  execute_action = true;
5034  }
5035  }
5036 
5037  if (execute_action && trigger->action != NULL)
5038  {
5039  if (trigger->action->time == tr_time)
5040  {
5041  if (eval_action (trigger, current, temp, rejected) != NO_ERROR)
5042  {
5043  rstatus = TR_RETURN_ERROR;
5044  }
5045 
5046  }
5047  else
5048  {
5049  /*
5050  * the action is not ready yet, return false to keep it
5051  * on the list
5052  */
5053 
5054  rstatus = TR_RETURN_FALSE;
5055  }
5056  }
5057  }
5058 
5059  if (save_user != NULL)
5060  {
5061  if (AU_SET_USER (save_user))
5062  {
5063  /* what can this mean ? */
5064  rstatus = TR_RETURN_ERROR;
5065  }
5066  }
5067 
5068  return rstatus;
5069 }
5070 
5071 /*
5072  * tr_execute_activities() - The function executes the conditions or actions or conditions and actions of all triggers
5073  * in the array that have the input execution time
5074  * return: int
5075  * state(in): trigger state
5076  * tr_time(in): execution time
5077  * current(in): object associated with "current"
5078  * temp(in): object associated with "new" or "old"
5079  *
5080  * Note:
5081  * The input execution time must not be TR_TIME_DEFERRED. For triggers in the array whose conditions are executed
5082  * and evaluated as true, their actions are also executed if they have the same execution time.
5083  * These triggers are then removed from the array. If any of these triggers has an action whose execution time is greater
5084  * than the execution time of its condition, the trigger is still kept in the array.
5085  * In the course of evaluating conditions and actions, if a "REJECT" action is encountered, the event action and
5086  * all the conditions and actions that are not yet executed will be suspended.
5087  */
5088 static int
5089 tr_execute_activities (TR_STATE * state, DB_TRIGGER_TIME tr_time, DB_OBJECT * current, DB_OBJECT * temp)
5090 {
5091  int error = NO_ERROR;
5092  TR_TRIGLIST *t, *next;
5093  int status;
5094  bool rejected;
5095 
5096  for (t = state->triggers, next = NULL; t != NULL && error == NO_ERROR; t = next)
5097  {
5098  next = t->next;
5099 
5100  status = execute_activity (t->trigger, tr_time, current, temp, &rejected);
5101 
5102  if (status == TR_RETURN_TRUE)
5103  {
5104  /* if rejected, signal an error and abort */
5105  if (rejected)
5106  {
5107  error = ER_TR_REJECTED;
5108  er_set (ER_WARNING_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 1, t->trigger->name);
5109  }
5110 
5111  /* successful processing, remove it from the list */
5112  remove_trigger_list_element (&state->triggers, t);
5113  }
5114  else if (status == TR_RETURN_ERROR)
5115  {
5116  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
5117  }
5118 
5119  /* else the trigger isn't ready yet, leave it on the list */
5120  }
5121 
5122  return error;
5123 }
5124 
5125 /*
5126  * run_user_triggers() - This runs triggers on the user trigger cache.
5127  * return: error code
5128  * event(in): event type to run
5129  * time(in):
5130  *
5131  * Note:
5132  * It is called by the various functions that handle various types of user trigger events.
5133  * Because the user triggers are maintained on a cache, we have to validate it before we can proceed.
5134  * We don't really have to worry about times right now because the user triggers all have limitations on their times.
5135  * The trigger cache will be sorted in priority order. We could have multiple lists for each type
5136  * but don't bother right now since there aren't likely to be very many of these.
5137  */
5138 static int
5139 run_user_triggers (DB_TRIGGER_EVENT event, DB_TRIGGER_TIME time)
5140 {
5141  TR_TRIGLIST *t;
5142  TR_STATE *state_p;
5143  int error = NO_ERROR;
5144  int status;
5145  bool rejected;
5146 
5147  /* check the cache */
5148  if (!tr_User_triggers_valid)
5149  {
5150  if (tr_update_user_cache () != NO_ERROR)
5151  {
5152  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
5153  return error;
5154  }
5155  }
5156 
5157  for (t = tr_User_triggers; t != NULL && !error; t = t->next)
5158  {
5159  if (t->trigger->event == event && t->trigger->status == TR_STATUS_ACTIVE)
5160  {
5161  state_p = NULL;
5162  if (start_state (&state_p, t->trigger->name) == NULL)
5163  {
5164  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
5165  break;
5166  }
5167 
5168  status = execute_activity (t->trigger, time, NULL, NULL, &rejected);
5169 
5170  tr_finish (state_p);
5171 
5172  if (status == TR_RETURN_TRUE)
5173  {
5174  /* if rejected, signal an error and abort */
5175  if (rejected)
5176  {
5177  error = ER_TR_REJECTED;
5178  er_set (ER_WARNING_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 1, t->trigger->name);
5179  }
5180  }
5181  else if (status == TR_RETURN_ERROR)
5182  {
5183  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
5184  }
5185  }
5186  }
5187 
5188  return error;
5189 }
5190 
5191 /* TRIGGER SIGNALING */
5192 
5193 /*
5194  * compare_recursion_levels() - The function compares two recursion levels.
5195  * return: int
5196  * rl_1(in): a recursion level
5197  * rl_2(in): a recursion level
5198  *
5199  * Note:
5200  * It returns 0 if they are equal,
5201  * 1 if the the first is greater than the second, or
5202  * -1 if the first is less than the second.
5203  */
5204 static int
5205 compare_recursion_levels (int rl_1, int rl_2)
5206 {
5207  int ret;
5208 
5209  if (rl_1 == rl_2)
5210  {
5211  ret = 0;
5212  }
5213  else
5214  {
5215  ret = (rl_1 > rl_2) ? 1 : -1;
5216  }
5217 
5218  return ret;
5219 }
5220 
5221 /*
5222  * start_state() - This is used to create a new state or validate an existing one.
5223  * return: state structure
5224  * current(in): existing state pointer
5225  * name(in):
5226  *
5227  * Note:
5228  * If we have to create a new one, check the recursion level for runaway triggers.
5229  */
5230 static TR_STATE *
5231 start_state (TR_STATE ** current, const char *name)
5232 {
5233  TR_STATE *state;
5234 
5235  state = *current;
5236  if (state == NULL)
5237  {
5238  ++tr_Current_depth;
5239  if (compare_recursion_levels (tr_Current_depth, tr_Maximum_depth) > 0)
5240  {
5241  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TR_EXCEEDS_MAX_REC_LEVEL, 2, tr_Maximum_depth, name);
5242  --tr_Current_depth;
5243  }
5244  else
5245  {
5246  state = make_state ();
5247  if (state != NULL)
5248  {
5249  *current = state;
5250  }
5251  }
5252  }
5253 
5254  return state;
5255 }
5256 
5257 /*
5258  * tr_prepare_statement() - This is called by do_statement() to prepare a trigger state structure for triggers that
5259  * will be raised by a statement.
5260  * return: error code
5261  * state_p(out):
5262  * event(in): event type
5263  * class(in): class being touched
5264  * attcount(in): number of entries in attribute name array
5265  * attnames(in): attribute name array
5266  *
5267  * Note:
5268  * Could build the trigger list separately and pass it to tr_prepare() but in this case we will always
5269  * be throwing away the merged list so it doesn't really matter.
5270  * If the statement is repeatable (in ESQL) it would be better if we could cache the trigger list in the parse tree
5271  * rather than having to derive it each time.
5272  */
5273 int
5274 tr_prepare_statement (TR_STATE ** state_p, DB_TRIGGER_EVENT event, DB_OBJECT * class_mop, int attcount,
5275  const char **attnames)
5276 {
5277  int error = NO_ERROR;
5278  TR_STATE *state;
5279  TR_TRIGLIST *triggers;
5280  TR_SCHEMA_CACHE *cache;
5281  int i, save;
5282 
5283  /*
5284  * Since we may be accessing this through a view, disable authorization during the building of the trigger lists.
5285  * Later when we actually evaluate the trigger condition/action, we will temporarily set the effective user
5286  * to the owner of the trigger.
5287  */
5288  AU_DISABLE (save);
5289 
5290  /* locate the list of triggers for this event */
5291  triggers = NULL;
5292 
5293  /* could avoid repeated schema authorization checks */
5294  error = sm_get_trigger_cache (class_mop, NULL, 0, (void **) &cache);
5295  if (error != NO_ERROR)
5296  {
5297  if (error == ER_HEAP_UNKNOWN_OBJECT)
5298  {
5299  /* Probably the client re-uses existing parse tree which refers a dropped table. To confirm it includes a
5300  * modified table, raise ER_QPROC_INVALID_XASLNODE.
5301  */
5302  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_QPROC_INVALID_XASLNODE, 0);
5303  }
5304 
5305  goto error_return;
5306  }
5307 
5308  if (cache != NULL)
5309  {
5310  if (tr_validate_schema_cache (cache, class_mop))
5311  {
5312  goto error_return;
5313  }
5314 
5315  if (event < cache->array_length)
5316  {
5317  if (merge_trigger_list (&triggers, cache->triggers[event], 0))
5318  {
5319  goto error_return;
5320  }
5321  }
5322  /* else error ? */
5323  }
5324 
5325  for (i = 0; i < attcount; i++)
5326  {
5327  error = sm_get_trigger_cache (class_mop, attnames[i], 0, (void **) &cache);
5328  if (error != NO_ERROR)
5329  {
5330  if (error == ER_HEAP_UNKNOWN_OBJECT)
5331  {
5332  /* Probably the client re-uses existing parse tree which refers a dropped table. To confirm it includes a
5333  * modified table, raise ER_QPROC_INVALID_XASLNODE.
5334  */
5335  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_QPROC_INVALID_XASLNODE, 0);
5336  }
5337  goto error_return;
5338  }
5339 
5340  if (cache != NULL)
5341  {
5342  if (tr_validate_schema_cache (cache, class_mop))
5343  {
5344  goto error_return;
5345  }
5346  else
5347  {
5348  if (event < cache->array_length)
5349  {
5350  error = merge_trigger_list (&triggers, cache->triggers[event], 0);
5351  if (error != NO_ERROR)
5352  {
5353  goto error_return;
5354  }
5355  }
5356  }
5357  }
5358  }
5359 
5360  /*
5361  * Construct a state structure for these events. If we get to the point where we can cache the trigger list
5362  * in the parse tree, the list should be returned here and passed to tr_prepare().
5363  */
5364  if (triggers != NULL)
5365  {
5366  /* pass in the first trigger name for the recursion error message */
5367  state = start_state (state_p, triggers->trigger->name);
5368  if (state == NULL)
5369  {
5370  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
5371  goto error_return;
5372  }
5373  else
5374  {
5375  if (state->triggers == NULL)
5376  {
5377  state->triggers = triggers;
5378  }
5379  else
5380  {
5381  error = merge_trigger_list (&state->triggers, triggers, 1);
5382  if (error != NO_ERROR)
5383  {
5384  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
5385  goto error_return;
5386  }
5387  }
5388  }
5389  }
5390 
5391  AU_ENABLE (save);
5392  return error;
5393 
5394 error_return:
5395  if (triggers != NULL)
5396  {
5397  tr_free_trigger_list (triggers);
5398  }
5399 
5400  AU_ENABLE (save);
5401 
5402  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
5403  return error;
5404 }
5405 
5406 #if defined(ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION)
5407 /*
5408  * tr_prepare() - This begins the preparation for trigger evaluation.
5409  * It may be called multiple times before calling tr_before().
5410  * return: error code
5411  * state_p(in): list of triggers to be prepared
5412  * triggers(in):
5413  *
5414  */
5415 int
5416 tr_prepare (TR_STATE ** state_p, TR_TRIGLIST * triggers)
5417 {
5418  int error = NO_ERROR;
5419  TR_STATE *state;
5420  const char *name;
5421  int save;
5422 
5423  /*
5424  * Disable authorization here since trigger scheduling is independent
5425  * of the current user. This will only only be necessary if we
5426  * have to fetch the trigger's owning class for some reason here.
5427  */
5428  AU_DISABLE (save);
5429 
5430  /* pass in the first trigger name for the recursion error message */
5431  name = (triggers != NULL) ? triggers->trigger->name : NULL;
5432  state = start_state (state_p, name);
5433  if (state == NULL)
5434  {
5435  assert (er_errid () != NO_ERROR);
5436  error = er_errid ();
5437  }
5438  else
5439  {
5440  merge_trigger_list (&state->triggers, triggers, 0);
5441  }
5442 
5443  AU_ENABLE (save);
5444 
5445  return error;
5446 }
5447 #endif /* ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION */
5448 
5449 /*
5450  * tr_prepare_class() - This is used to prepare a trigger state for an event on a class.
5451  * return: error code
5452  * state_p(in/out): trigger state pointer
5453  * cache(in): class trigger cache
5454  * class_mop(in): class mop
5455  * event(in): event being raised
5456  *
5457  */
5458 int
5459 tr_prepare_class (TR_STATE ** state_p, TR_SCHEMA_CACHE * cache, MOP class_mop, DB_TRIGGER_EVENT event)
5460 {
5461  int error = NO_ERROR;
5462  TR_STATE *state;
5463  TR_TRIGLIST *triggers;
5464  const char *name;
5465  int save;
5466 
5467  if (!TR_EXECUTION_ENABLED)
5468  {
5469  *state_p = NULL;
5470  return NO_ERROR;
5471  }
5472 
5473  if (cache == NULL)
5474  {
5475  return NO_ERROR;
5476  }
5477 
5478  /*
5479  * Disable authorization here since trigger scheduling is independent * of the current user.
5480  * This will only only be necessary if we have to fetch the trigger's owning class for some reason here.
5481  */
5482  AU_DISABLE (save);
5483 
5484  if (tr_validate_schema_cache (cache, class_mop) != NO_ERROR)
5485  {
5486  assert (er_errid () != NO_ERROR);
5487  error = er_errid ();
5488  }
5489  else if (event < cache->array_length)
5490  {
5491  triggers = cache->triggers[event];
5492 
5493  /* pass in name of first trigger for message */
5494  name = (triggers != NULL) ? triggers->trigger->name : NULL;
5495  state = start_state (state_p, name);
5496  if (state == NULL)
5497  {
5498  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
5499  }
5500  else
5501  {
5502  merge_trigger_list (&state->triggers, triggers, 0);
5503  }
5504  }
5505  else
5506  {
5507  assert (false);
5508  }
5509 
5510  AU_ENABLE (save);
5511  return error;
5512 }
5513 
5514 /*
5515  * tr_finish() - The function wraps up the firing of a trigger.
5516  * return: none
5517  * state(in): trigger execution state
5518  *
5519  * Note: The function wraps up the firing of a trigger.
5520  * Note that at this point, only triggers containing deferred conditions or actions remain in the array and
5521  * the list of raised triggers.
5522  */
5523 static void
5524 tr_finish (TR_STATE * state)
5525 {
5526  /* if we have to touch the trigger class for any reason, we'll need to disable authorization here */
5527 
5528  if (state)
5529  {
5530  free_state (state);
5531  --tr_Current_depth;
5532  }
5533 }
5534 
5535 /*
5536  * tr_abort() - The function aborts the rest of the trigger firing operation.
5537  * In addition to freeing the state, this will also cancel anything on the raised trigger list.
5538  * return: none
5539  * state(in): trigger execution state
5540  *
5541  */
5542 void
5543 tr_abort (TR_STATE * state)
5544 {
5545  /* if we have to touch the trigger class for any reason, we'll need to disable authorization here */
5546 
5547  /* don't really need to do anything other than free the existing state */
5548  if (state)
5549  {
5550  tr_finish (state);
5551  }
5552 }

5554 /*
5555  * tr_before_object() - The function tr_before_object should be used after tr_prepare.
5556  * return: error
5557  * state(in): trigger execution state
5558  * current(in): current event object
5559  * temp(in): temporary event object
5560  *
5561  * Note:
5562  * See the Note of tr_prepare.
5563  * Trigger conditions and actions with execution time BEFORE are evaluated and executed in tr_before_object other
5564  * conditions and actions are handled in tr_after_object.
5565  *
5566  */
5567 int
5568 tr_before_object (TR_STATE * state, DB_OBJECT * current, DB_OBJECT * temp)
5569 {
5570  int error = NO_ERROR;
5571 
5572  if (!TR_EXECUTION_ENABLED)
5573  {
5574  return NO_ERROR;
5575  }
5576 
5577  if (state)
5578  {
5579  error = tr_execute_activities (state, TR_TIME_BEFORE, current, temp);
5580  if (error != NO_ERROR)
5581  {
5582  tr_abort (state);
5583  }
5584  }
5585 
5586  return error;
5587 }
5588 
5589 /*
5590  * tr_before() - The function tr_before should be used after tr_prepare.
5591  * return: error code
5592  * state(in): trigger execution state
5593  *
5594  * Note:
5595  * See the Note of tr_prepare.
5596  * Trigger conditions and actions with execution time BEFORE are evaluated and executed in tr_before;
5597  * other conditions and actions are handled in tr_after.
5598  */
5599 int
5600 tr_before (TR_STATE * state)
5601 {
5602  return tr_before_object (state, NULL, NULL);
5603 }
5604 
5605 /*
5606  * tr_after_object() - The function executes all AFTER conditions and actions,
5607  * and does preparation work for all DEFERRED conditions and actions of the triggers fired.
5608  * return: error code
5609  * state(in): trigger execution state
5610  * current(in): current event object
5611  * temp(in): temporary event object
5612  *
5613  */
5614 int
5615 tr_after_object (TR_STATE * state, DB_OBJECT * current, DB_OBJECT * temp)
5616 {
5617  int error = NO_ERROR;
5618 
5619  if (!TR_EXECUTION_ENABLED)
5620  {
5621  return NO_ERROR;
5622  }
5623 
5624  if (state)
5625  {
5626  error = tr_execute_activities (state, TR_TIME_AFTER, current, temp);
5627 
5628  if (error != NO_ERROR)
5629  {
5630  tr_abort (state);
5631  }
5632  else
5633  {
5634  /*
5635  * at this point, the only things remaining on the state trigger list are deferred conditions and actions.
5636  * Add them to the end of the global list.
5637  */
5638  if (state->triggers != NULL)
5639  {
5640  add_deferred_activities (state->triggers, current);
5641  state->triggers = NULL;
5642  }
5643  tr_finish (state);
5644  }
5645  }
5646 
5647  return error;
5648 }
5649 
5650 /*
5651  * tr_after() - The function executes all AFTER conditions and actions, and
5652  * does preparation work for all DEFERRED conditions and actions of the triggers fired.
5653  * return: error code
5654  * state(in): trigger execution state
5655  *
5656  */
5657 int
5658 tr_after (TR_STATE * state)
5659 {
5660  return tr_after_object (state, NULL, NULL);
5661 }
