5663 /*
5664  * tr_has_user_trigger() - Check whether has a trigger to execute at commit|rollback
5665  * return: error code
5666  * has_user_trigger(out): true, if has user trigger to execute, otherwise false
5667  */
5668 int
5669 tr_has_user_trigger (bool * has_user_trigger)
5670 {
5671  TR_TRIGLIST *t;
5672  int error = NO_ERROR;
5673  bool has_user_trigger_local;
5674 
5675  assert (has_user_trigger != NULL);
5676  if (!TR_EXECUTION_ENABLED)
5677  {
5678  *has_user_trigger = false;
5679  return NO_ERROR;
5680  }
5681 
5682  if (tr_Deferred_activities)
5683  {
5684  *has_user_trigger = true;
5685  return NO_ERROR;
5686  }
5687 
5688  if (!tr_User_triggers_valid)
5689  {
5690  if (tr_update_user_cache () != NO_ERROR)
5691  {
5692  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
5693  return error;
5694  }
5695  }
5696 
5697  has_user_trigger_local = false;
5698  for (t = tr_User_triggers; t != NULL; t = t->next)
5699  {
5700  if (t->trigger->status == TR_STATUS_ACTIVE)
5701  {
5702  has_user_trigger_local = true;
5703  break;
5704  }
5705  }
5706 
5707  *has_user_trigger = has_user_trigger_local;
5708  return NO_ERROR;
5709 }
5710 
5711 /*
5712  * tr_check_commit_triggers() - This is called by tran_commit() early in the commit sequence.
5713  * return: error code
5714  * time(in):
5715  *
5716  * Note:
5717  * This is called by tran_commit() early in the commit sequence.
5718  * It will execute any deferred trigger activities.
5719  * It may return an error which means that the transaction is not committable.
5720  */
5721 int
5722 tr_check_commit_triggers (DB_TRIGGER_TIME time)
5723 {
5724  int error = NO_ERROR;
5725 
5726  /*
5727  * If trigger firing has been disabled, do nothing.
5728  * This is currently used by the loader to disable triggers firing.
5729  */
5730  if (!TR_EXECUTION_ENABLED)
5731  {
5732  return NO_ERROR;
5733  }
5734 
5735  /*
5736  * Do we run the deferred activities before the commit triggers ?
5737  * If not, the commit trigger can schedule deferred activities as well.
5738  */
5739 
5740  if (run_user_triggers (TR_EVENT_COMMIT, time))
5741  {
5742  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
5743  return error;
5744  }
5745 
5746  /*
5747  * if this returns an error, we may wish to override it with a more generic trigger error.
5748  */
5749  if (time == TR_TIME_BEFORE)
5750  {
5751  if (tr_execute_deferred_activities (NULL, NULL))
5752  {
5753  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
5754  return error;
5755  }
5756 
5757  if (tr_Invalid_transaction)
5758  {
5759  error = ER_TR_TRANSACTION_INVALIDATED;
5760  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 1, tr_Invalid_transaction_trigger);
5761  }
5762  else if (tr_Uncommitted_triggers != NULL)
5763  {
5764  /* the things on this list are going to make it */
5765  tr_free_trigger_list (tr_Uncommitted_triggers);
5766  tr_Uncommitted_triggers = NULL;
5767  }
5768  }
5769 
5770  /*
5771  * clear this flag so we know when triggers are updated during a transaction
5772  */
5773  tr_User_triggers_modified = 0;
5774 
5775  return error;
5776 }
5777 
5778 /*
5779  * tr_check_rollback_triggers() - This is called by tran_abort early in the abort sequence.
5780  * return: none
5781  * time(in):
5782  *
5783  * Note:
5784  * It will toss out any deferred activities and raise any triggers on the abort event.
5785  * The abort operation itself cannot be rejected.
5786  * We also perform some housekeeping here for the user trigger cache.
5787  */
5788 void
5789 tr_check_rollback_triggers (DB_TRIGGER_TIME time)
5790 {
5791  TR_TRIGLIST *t, *next;
5792 
5793  /*
5794  * If trigger firing has been disabled, do nothing.
5795  * This is currently used by the loader to disable triggers firing.
5796  */
5797  if (!TR_EXECUTION_ENABLED)
5798  {
5799  return;
5800  }
5801 
5802  /*
5803  * Run user triggers FIRST, even if they were created during this transaction.
5804  */
5805  (void) run_user_triggers (TR_EVENT_ROLLBACK, time);
5806 
5807  /*
5808  * can the rollback triggers have deferred activities ? if so need to execute the deferred list now
5809  */
5810 
5811  /*
5812  * make sure that any triggers created during this session are removed,
5813  * especially those on the rollback event itself
5814  */
5815  if (tr_Uncommitted_triggers != NULL)
5816  {
5817  for (t = tr_Uncommitted_triggers, next = NULL; t != NULL; t = next)
5818  {
5819  next = t->next;
5820  /* this will also remove it from the tr_Uncommitted_triggers list */
5821  tr_drop_trigger_internal (t->trigger, 1, false);
5822  }
5823  /*
5824  * shouldn't be necessary if tr_drop_trigger_intenral is doing its job
5825  */
5826  tr_free_trigger_list (tr_Uncommitted_triggers);
5827  tr_Uncommitted_triggers = NULL;
5828  }
5829 
5830  /* ignore any deferred activities */
5831  flush_deferred_activities ();
5832 
5833  /* this always gets cleared when the transaction aborts */
5834  tr_Invalid_transaction = false;
5835 
5836  if (tr_User_triggers_modified)
5837  {
5838  tr_User_triggers_valid = 0;
5839  tr_User_triggers_modified = 0;
5840  }
5841 }
5842 
5843 #if defined(ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION)
5844 /*
5845  * tr_check_timeout_triggers() - This is called whenever a lock timeout ocurrs.
5846  * return: none
5847  *
5848  * Note:
5849  * The timeout can't be prevented but the user may wish to insert triggers for side effects.
5850  */
5851 void
5852 tr_check_timeout_triggers (void)
5853 {
5854  if (!TR_EXECUTION_ENABLED)
5855  {
5856  return;
5857  }
5858  (void) run_user_triggers (TR_EVENT_TIMEOUT, TR_TIME_AFTER);
5859 }
5860 #endif /* ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION */
5861 
5862 /*
5863  * tr_check_abort_triggers() - This is called whenever the client is unilaterally aborted for some reason.
5864  * return: none
5865  *
5866  * Note:
5867  * This is called whenever the client is unilaterally aborted for some reason.
5868  * This is different than tr_check_rollback_triggers() because that function is only called
5869  * if the user voluntarily calls tran_abort().
5870  */
5871 void
5872 tr_check_abort_triggers (void)
5873 {
5874  /*
5875  * If trigger firing has been disabled, do nothing.
5876  * This is currently used by the loader to disable triggers firing.
5877  */
5878  if (!TR_EXECUTION_ENABLED)
5879  {
5880  return;
5881  }
5882 
5883  (void) run_user_triggers (TR_EVENT_ABORT, TR_TIME_AFTER);
5884 
5885  /*
5886  * can the abort triggers have deferred activities ? if so
5887  * need to execute the deferred list now
5888  */
5889 
5890  /* ignore any deferred activities */
5891  flush_deferred_activities ();
5892 
5893  /* this always gets cleared when the transaction aborts */
5894  tr_Invalid_transaction = false;
5895 }
5896 
5897 /* DEFERRED ACTIVITY CONTROL */
5898 
5899 /*
5900  * its_deleted() - This is called to look at objects associated with deferred triggers to make sure they still exist.
5901  * return: non-zero if the object is deleted
5902  * object(in): object to examine
5903  *
5904  * Note:
5905  * Try to determine this as quickly as posible. This should be a general ws_ function or something.
5906  */
5907 static int
5908 its_deleted (DB_OBJECT * object)
5909 {
5910  int deleted = 0;
5911 
5912  /*
5913  * Ok, in order for the object to be on the deferred trigger list,
5914  * it must have existed at the time the trigger was raised. If it was deleted, the MOP will have the deleted bit set.
5915  * The only time we can be referencing a deleted MOP that doesn't have the deleted bit set is if the MOP has never
5916  * been locked by this transaction.
5917  * Since we must have locked this object in order to fire a trigger on it, that case isn't possible.
5918  */
5919 
5920  if (object != NULL)
5921  {
5922  /* fast way */
5923  if (object->decached == 0)
5924  {
5925  deleted = WS_IS_DELETED (object);
5926  }
5927  else
5928  {
5929  int error;
5930 
5931  error = au_fetch_instance_force (object, NULL, AU_FETCH_READ, TM_TRAN_READ_FETCH_VERSION ());
5932  if (error == ER_HEAP_UNKNOWN_OBJECT)
5933  {
5934  deleted = 1;
5935  }
5936  }
5937 
5938  /* Slow but safe way */
5939 #if 0
5940  error = au_fetch_instance_force (object, &mem, AU_FETCH_READ);
5941  if (error == ER_HEAP_UNKNOWN_OBJECT)
5942  deleted = 1;
5943 #endif /* 0 */
5944  }
5945 
5946  return deleted;
5947 }
5948 
5949 /*
5950  * tr_execute_deferred_activities() - This function executes any deferred activities for a trigger.
5951  * return: error code
5952  * trigger_object(in): trigger object
5953  * target(in): associated target instance
5954  *
5955  * Note:
5956  * This function executes any deferred activities for a trigger.
5957  * If the object argument is NULL, all of the deferred activities for the given trigger are executed.
5958  * If supplied, only those activities that are associated with the given target object are executed.
5959  * If the target argument is NULL, all deferred activities for the given trigger are executed.
5960  * If both arguments are NULL, all deferred activities are executed unconditionally.
5961  *
5962  */
5963 int
5964 tr_execute_deferred_activities (DB_OBJECT * trigger_object, DB_OBJECT * target)
5965 {
5966  int error = NO_ERROR;
5967  TR_DEFERRED_CONTEXT *c, *c_next;
5968  TR_TRIGLIST *t, *next;
5969  TR_TRIGGER *trigger;
5970  TR_STATE *state_p;
5971  int status;
5972  bool rejected;
5973 
5974  /*
5975  * If trigger firing has been disabled, do nothing.
5976  * This is currently used by the loader to disable trigger firing.
5977  */
5978  if (!TR_EXECUTION_ENABLED)
5979  {
5980  return NO_ERROR;
5981  }
5982 
5983  for (c = tr_Deferred_activities, c_next = NULL; c != NULL && !error; c = c_next)
5984  {
5985  c_next = c->next;
5986 
5987  for (t = c->head, next = NULL; t != NULL && !error; t = next)
5988  {
5989  next = t->next;
5990  trigger = t->trigger;
5991 
5992  if ((trigger_object == NULL || trigger->object == trigger_object) && (target == NULL || t->target == target))
5993  {
5994  if (its_deleted (t->target))
5995  {
5996  /*
5997  * Somewhere along the line, the target object was deleted, quietly ignore the deferred activity.
5998  * If it turns out that we really want to keep these active, we'll have to contend with
5999  * what pt_exec_trigger_stmt is going to do when we pass it deleted objects.
6000  */
6001  remove_deferred_activity (c, t);
6002  }
6003  else
6004  {
6005  state_p = NULL;
6006  if (start_state (&state_p, t->trigger->name) == NULL)
6007  {
6008  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
6009  break;
6010  }
6011 
6012  status = execute_activity (trigger, TR_TIME_DEFERRED, t->target, NULL, &rejected);
6013 
6014  tr_finish (state_p);
6015 
6016  /* execute_activity() maybe include trigger and change the next pointer. we need get it again. */
6017  next = t->next;
6018  if (status == TR_RETURN_TRUE)
6019  {
6020  /* successful processing, remove it from the list */
6021  remove_deferred_activity (c, t);
6022 
6023  /* reject can't happen here, even if it does, it is unclear what it would mean */
6024  }
6025  else if (status == TR_RETURN_ERROR)
6026  {
6027  /*
6028  * if an error happens, should we invalidate the transaction ?
6029  */
6030  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
6031  }
6032 
6033  /* else, thinks the trigger can't be evaluated yet, shouldn't happen */
6034  }
6035  }
6036  }
6037 
6038  /*
6039  * if we deleted all of the deferred triggers in this context, remove the context as well
6040  */
6041  if (c->head == NULL)
6042  {
6043  remove_deferred_context (c);
6044  }
6045  }
6046 
6047  return error;
6048 }
6049 
6050 /*
6051  * tr_drop_deferred_activities() - This functio removes any deferred activities for a trigger.
6052  * return: error code
6053  * trigger_object(in): trigger object
6054  * target(in): target object
6055  *
6056  * Note:
6057  * This function removes any deferred activities for a trigger.
6058  * If the target argument is NULL, all of the deferred activities for the given trigger are removed.
6059  * If supplied, only those activities associated with the target object are removed.
6060  */
6061 int
6062 tr_drop_deferred_activities (DB_OBJECT * trigger_object, DB_OBJECT * target)
6063 {
6064  int error = NO_ERROR;
6065  TR_DEFERRED_CONTEXT *c, *c_next;
6066  TR_TRIGLIST *t, *next;
6067 
6068  /* could signal some errors here if the trigger isn't deferrable etc. */
6069 
6070  for (c = tr_Deferred_activities, c_next = NULL; c != NULL && !error; c = c_next)
6071  {
6072  c_next = c->next;
6073 
6074  for (t = c->head, next = NULL; t != NULL && !error; t = next)
6075  {
6076  next = t->next;
6077 
6078  if ((trigger_object == NULL || t->trigger->object == trigger_object)
6079  && (target == NULL || t->target == target))
6080  {
6081  if (ws_is_same_object (Au_user, Au_dba_user) || ws_is_same_object (Au_user, t->trigger->owner))
6082  {
6083  remove_deferred_activity (c, t);
6084  }
6085  else
6086  {
6087  error = ER_TR_ACTIVITY_NOT_OWNED;
6088  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 0);
6089  }
6090  }
6091  }
6092 
6093  if (c->head == NULL)
6094  {
6095  remove_deferred_context (c);
6096  }
6097  }
6098 
6099  return error;
6100 }

6388 /*
6389  * tr_trigger_action() - This function finds the action of the input trigger.
6390  * return: error code
6391  * trigger_object(in): trigger object
6392  * action(out): pointer to the return trigger action
6393  *
6394  * Note:
6395  * If access to the internal object that contains the trigger definition can not be obtained,
6396  * the trigger cannot be identified or seen by the user, or the user does not have the SELECT privilege
6397  * for the class in the trigger's event target, an error code will be returned.
6398  */
6399 int
6400 tr_trigger_action (DB_OBJECT * trigger_object, char **action)
6401 {
6402  int error = NO_ERROR;
6403  TR_TRIGGER *trigger;
6404  int save;
6405  char buf[TR_MAX_PRINT_STRING + 32];
6406 
6407  *action = NULL;
6408  AU_DISABLE (save);
6409 
6410  trigger = tr_map_trigger (trigger_object, 1);
6411  if (trigger == NULL)
6412  {
6413  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
6414  }
6415  else if (trigger->action != NULL)
6416  {
6417  switch (trigger->action->type)
6418  {
6419  case TR_ACT_NULL:
6420  /* no condition */
6421  break;
6422 
6423  case TR_ACT_EXPRESSION:
6424  *action = ws_copy_string (trigger->action->source);
6425  break;
6426 
6427  case TR_ACT_REJECT:
6428  *action = ws_copy_string ("REJECT");
6429  break;
6430 
6431  case TR_ACT_INVALIDATE:
6432  *action = ws_copy_string ("INVALIDATE TRANSACTION");
6433  break;
6434 
6435  case TR_ACT_PRINT:
6436  /* sigh, need a nice adjustable string array package */
6437  snprintf (buf, sizeof (buf) - 1, "PRINT '%s'", trigger->action->source);
6438  *action = ws_copy_string (buf);
6439  break;
6440 
6441  default:
6442  /* error ? */
6443  break;
6444  }
6445  }
6446 
6447  AU_ENABLE (save);
6448  return error;
6449 }

6451 /*
6452  * tr_trigger_action_time() - This function finds the execution time of the trigger action.
6453  * return: error code
6454  * trigger_object(in): trigger object
6455  * tr_time(in): pointer to the return execution time of the trigger action
6456  *
6457  * Note:
6458  * If access to the internal object that contains the trigger definition can not be obtained,
6459  * the trigger cannot be identified or seen by the user, or the user does not have the SELECT privilege
6460  * for the class in the trigger's event target, an error code will be returned.
6461  */
6462 int
6463 tr_trigger_action_time (DB_OBJECT * trigger_object, DB_TRIGGER_TIME * tr_time)
6464 {
6465  int error = NO_ERROR;
6466  TR_TRIGGER *trigger;
6467  int save;
6468 
6469  *tr_time = TR_TIME_NULL;
6470  AU_DISABLE (save);
6471 
6472  trigger = tr_map_trigger (trigger_object, 1);

6476  }

6478  {
6479  *tr_time = trigger->action->time;
6480  }
6481 
6482  AU_ENABLE (save);
6483  return error;
6484 }

6698 /*
6699  * tr_dump_trigger() - This function is used to dump a trigger definition in ASCII format so that it can be read and
6700  * re-defined from the csql interpreter.
6701  * It is intended to support the unloaddb/loadbdb migration utilities.
6702  * return: error code
6703  * trigger_object(in): trigger object
6704  * fp(in): output file
6705  * quoted_id_flag(in):
6706  */
6707 int
6708 tr_dump_trigger (DB_OBJECT * trigger_object, FILE * fp)
6709 {
6710  int error = NO_ERROR;
6711  TR_TRIGGER *trigger;
6712  DB_TRIGGER_TIME time;
6713  int save;
6714  const char *name;
6715 
6716  AU_DISABLE (save);
6717 
6718  trigger = tr_map_trigger (trigger_object, 1);
6719 
6720  if (trigger == NULL)
6721  {
6722  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
6723  }
6724  else if (trigger->status != TR_STATUS_INVALID)
6725  {
6726  /* automatically filter out invalid triggers */
6727 
6728  fprintf (fp, "CREATE TRIGGER ");
6729  fprintf (fp, "[%s]\n", trigger->name);
6730  fprintf (fp, " STATUS %s\n", tr_status_as_string (trigger->status));
6731  fprintf (fp, " PRIORITY %f\n", trigger->priority);
6732 
6733  time = TR_TIME_BEFORE;
6734  if (trigger->condition != NULL)
6735  {
6736  time = trigger->condition->time;
6737  }
6738  else if (trigger->action != NULL)
6739  {
6740  time = trigger->action->time;
6741  }
6742 
6743  /* BEFORE UPDATE etc. */
6744  fprintf (fp, " %s %s", tr_time_as_string (time), tr_event_as_string (trigger->event));
6745 
6746  if (trigger->class_mop != NULL)
6747  {
6748  name = db_get_class_name (trigger->class_mop);
6749  fprintf (fp, " ON ");
6750  fprintf (fp, "[%s]", name);
6751 
6752  if (trigger->attribute != NULL)
6753  {
6754  fprintf (fp, "([%s])", trigger->attribute);
6755  }
6756  }
6757  fprintf (fp, "\n");
6758 
6759  if (trigger->condition != NULL)
6760  {
6761  fprintf (fp, "IF %s\n", trigger->condition->source);
6762  }
6763 
6764  if (trigger->action != NULL)
6765  {
6766  fprintf (fp, " EXECUTE ");
6767  if (trigger->action->time != time)
6768  {
6769  fprintf (fp, "%s ", tr_time_as_string (trigger->action->time));
6770  }
6771  switch (trigger->action->type)
6772  {
6773  case TR_ACT_EXPRESSION:
6774  fprintf (fp, "%s", trigger->action->source);
6775  break;
6776  case TR_ACT_REJECT:
6777  fprintf (fp, "REJECT");
6778  break;
6779  case TR_ACT_INVALIDATE:
6780  fprintf (fp, "INVALIDATE TRANSACTION");
6781  break;
6782  case TR_ACT_PRINT:
6783  fprintf (fp, "PRINT '%s'", trigger->action->source);
6784  break;
6785  default:
6786  fprintf (fp, "???");
6787  break;
6788  }
6789  }
6790 
6791  if (trigger->comment != NULL && trigger->comment[0] != '\0')
6792  {
6793  fprintf (fp, " ");
6794  help_fprint_describe_comment (fp, trigger->comment);
6795  }
6796 
6797  fprintf (fp, ";\n");
6798  }
6799 
6800  AU_ENABLE (save);
6801  return error;
6802 }
6803 
6804 /*
6805  * get_user_name() - Shorthand function for getting the user name out of a user object.
6806  * The name is stored in a static array so we don't have to worry about freeing it.
6807  * return: user name
6808  * user(in): user object
6809  */
6810 static char *
6811 get_user_name (DB_OBJECT * user)
6812 {
6813  DB_VALUE value;
6814  char *tmp;
6815 
6816  if (db_get (user, "name", &value))
6817  { /* error */
6818  strcpy (namebuf, "???");
6819  return namebuf;
6820  }
6821 
6822  if (DB_VALUE_TYPE (&value) != DB_TYPE_STRING || DB_IS_NULL (&value) || db_get_string (&value) == NULL)
6823  {
6824  strcpy (namebuf, "???");
6825  }
6826  else
6827  {
6828  tmp = db_get_string (&value);
6829  if (tmp)
6830  {
6831  strncpy (namebuf, tmp, sizeof (namebuf) - 1);
6832  }
6833  namebuf[MAX_USER_NAME - 1] = '\0';
6834  }
6835  db_value_clear (&value);
6836 
6837  return namebuf;
6838 }
6839 
6840 #if defined(ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION)
6841 /*
6842  * tr_dump_all_triggers() - This is intended to support the unloaddb/loaddb utilities.
6843  * return: error code
6844  * fp(in): output file
6845  * quoted_id_flag(in):
6846  *
6847  * Note:
6848  * This is intended to support the unloaddb/loaddb utilities.
6849  * It dumps a csql script that can be used to regenerate all of the currently defined triggers.
6850  * It uses the login() method without passwords and as such assumes that we are running as the 'DBA' user.
6851  * NOTE: Do not dump triggers if they are defined on one of the system classes.
6852  * These are defined as part of "createdb" and must not be emitted in the unloaddb schema file.
6853  * This does however prevent users from defining their own triggers on the system classes but this isn't
6854  * much of a limitation since users can't alter the system classes in any other way.
6855  */
6856 int
6857 tr_dump_all_triggers (FILE * fp, bool quoted_id_flag)
6858 {
6859  int error = NO_ERROR;
6860  TR_TRIGGER *trigger;
6861  DB_SET *table;
6862  DB_VALUE value;
6863  DB_OBJECT *trigger_object;
6864  int max, i;
6865 
6866  if (Au_root != NULL && (error = obj_get (Au_root, "triggers", &value)) == NO_ERROR)
6867  {
6868  if (DB_IS_NULL (&value))
6869  {
6870  table = NULL;
6871  }
6872  else
6873  {
6874  table = db_get_set (&value);
6875  }
6876  if (table != NULL)
6877  {
6878  error = set_filter (table);
6879  max = set_size (table);
6880  for (i = 1; i < max && error == NO_ERROR; i += 2)
6881  {
6882  if ((error = set_get_element (table, i, &value)) == NO_ERROR)
6883  {
6884  if (DB_VALUE_TYPE (&value) == DB_TYPE_OBJECT && !DB_IS_NULL (&value)
6885  && db_get_object (&value) != NULL)
6886  {
6887  trigger_object = db_get_object (&value);
6888  trigger = tr_map_trigger (trigger_object, 1);
6889  if (trigger == NULL)
6890  {
6891  assert (er_errid () != NO_ERROR);
6892  error = er_errid ();
6893  }
6894  else
6895  {
6896  /* don't dump system class triggers */
6897  if (trigger->class_mop == NULL || !sm_is_system_class (trigger->class_mop))
6898  {
6899 
6900  if (trigger->status != TR_STATUS_INVALID)
6901  {
6902  tr_dump_trigger (trigger_object, fp, quoted_id_flag);
6903  fprintf (fp, "call [change_trigger_owner]('%s'," " '%s') on class [db_root];\n\n",
6904  trigger->name, get_user_name (trigger->owner));
6905  }
6906  }
6907  }
6908  }
6909  }
6910  }
6911  set_free (table);
6912  }
6913  }
6914 
6915  return error;
6916 }
6917 #endif /* ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION */

6919 /*
6920  * is_required_trigger() -
6921  * return: int
6922  * trigger(in):
6923  * classes(in):
6924  */
6925 static int
6926 is_required_trigger (TR_TRIGGER * trigger, DB_OBJLIST * classes)
6927 {
6928  DB_OBJLIST *cl;
6929 
6930  for (cl = classes; cl != NULL; cl = cl->next)
6931  {
6932  if (trigger->class_mop == cl->op)
6933  {
6934  return 1;
6935  }
6936  }
6937 
6938  return 0;
6939 }

6941 /*
6942  * tr_dump_selective_triggers() -
6943  * return: error code
6944  * fp(in):
6945  * quoted_id_flag(in):
6946  * classes(in):
6947  */
6948 int
6949 tr_dump_selective_triggers (FILE * fp, DB_OBJLIST * classes)
6950 {
6951  int error = NO_ERROR;
6952  TR_TRIGGER *trigger;
6953  DB_SET *table;
6954  DB_VALUE value;
6955  DB_OBJECT *trigger_object;
6956  int max, i;
6957 
6958  if (Au_root == NULL)
6959  {
6960  return NO_ERROR;
6961  }
6962 
6963  error = obj_get (Au_root, "triggers", &value);
6964  if (error != NO_ERROR)
6965  {
6966  return error;
6967  }
6968 
6969  if (DB_IS_NULL (&value))
6970  {
6971  table = NULL;
6972  }
6973  else
6974  {
6975  table = db_get_set (&value);
6976  }
6977 
6978  if (table == NULL)
6979  {
6980  return NO_ERROR;
6981  }
6982 
6983  error = set_filter (table);
6984  max = set_size (table);
6985  for (i = 1; i < max && error == NO_ERROR; i += 2)
6986  {
6987  error = set_get_element (table, i, &value);
6988  if (error == NO_ERROR)
6989  {
6990  if (DB_VALUE_TYPE (&value) == DB_TYPE_OBJECT && !DB_IS_NULL (&value) && db_get_object (&value) != NULL)
6991  {
6992  trigger_object = db_get_object (&value);
6993  trigger = tr_map_trigger (trigger_object, 1);
6994  if (trigger == NULL)
6995  {
6996  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
6997  }
6998  else
6999  {
7000  int is_system_class = 0;
7001 
7002  if (trigger->class_mop != NULL && !is_required_trigger (trigger, classes))
7003  {
7004  continue;
7005  }
7006 
7007  /* don't dump system class triggers */
7008  if (trigger->class_mop != NULL)
7009  {
7010  is_system_class = sm_is_system_class (trigger->class_mop);
7011  }
7012  if (is_system_class == 0)
7013  {
7014  if (trigger->status != TR_STATUS_INVALID)
7015  {
7016  tr_dump_trigger (trigger_object, fp);
7017  fprintf (fp, "call [change_trigger_owner]('%s'," " '%s') on class [db_root];\n\n",
7018  trigger->name, get_user_name (trigger->owner));
7019  }
7020  }
7021  else if (is_system_class < 0)
7022  {
7023  error = is_system_class;
7024  }
7025  }
7026  }
7027  }
7028  }
7029  set_free (table);
7030 
7031  return error;
7032 }

7035 /* TRIGGER ALTER OPERATIONS */
7036 
7037 /*
7038  * tr_rename_trigger() - Renames a trigger. The new name cannot already be in use.
7039  * return: error code
7040  * trigger_object(in): trigger object
7041  * name(in): new trigger name
7042  * call_from_api(in): call from api
7043  */
7044 int
7045 tr_rename_trigger (DB_OBJECT * trigger_object, const char *name, bool call_from_api)
7046 {
7047  int error = NO_ERROR;
7048  TR_TRIGGER *trigger;
7049  DB_VALUE value;
7050  char *newname, *oldname;
7051  char *tr_name = NULL;
7052  int save;
7053  bool has_savepoint = false;
7054 
7055  /* Do we need to disable authorization just for check_authorization ? */
7056  AU_DISABLE (save);
7057 
7058  trigger = tr_map_trigger (trigger_object, true);
7059  if (trigger == NULL)
7060  {
7061  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
7062  }
7063  else
7064  {
7065  tr_name = strdup (trigger->name);
7066  }
7067 
7068  if (trigger == NULL)
7069  {
7070  ;
7071  }
7072  else if (!check_authorization (trigger, true))
7073  {
7074  error = ER_TR_TRIGGER_ALTER_FAILURE;
7075  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 1, trigger->name);
7076  }
7077  else
7078  {
7079  newname = tr_process_name (name);
7080  if (newname == NULL)
7081  {
7082  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
7083  }
7084  else
7085  {
7086  if (TM_TRAN_ISOLATION () >= TRAN_REP_READ)
7087  {
7088  /* protect against multiple flushes to server */
7089  error = tran_system_savepoint (UNIQUE_SAVEPOINT_RENAME_TRIGGER);
7090  if (error == NO_ERROR)
7091  {
7092  has_savepoint = true;
7093  }
7094  }
7095 
7096  if (error == NO_ERROR)
7097  {
7098  error = trigger_table_rename (trigger_object, newname);
7099  }
7100 
7101  /* might need to abort the transaction here */
7102  if (error == NO_ERROR)
7103  {
7104  oldname = trigger->name;
7105  trigger->name = newname;
7106  db_make_string (&value, newname);
7107  newname = NULL;
7108  error = db_put_internal (trigger_object, TR_ATT_NAME, &value);
7109  if (error == NO_ERROR)
7110  {
7111  error = locator_flush_instance (trigger_object);
7112  }
7113 
7114  if (error != NO_ERROR)
7115  {
7116  /*
7117  * hmm, couldn't set the new name, put the old one back,
7118  * we might need to abort the transaction here ?
7119  */
7120  ASSERT_ERROR ();
7121  newname = trigger->name;
7122  trigger->name = oldname;
7123  /* if we can't do this, the transaction better abort */
7124  (void) trigger_table_rename (trigger_object, oldname);
7125  oldname = NULL;
7126  }
7127  if (oldname != NULL)
7128  {
7129  free_and_init (oldname);
7130  }
7131  }
7132 
7133  if (newname != NULL)
7134  {
7135  free_and_init (newname);
7136  }
7137  }
7138  }
7139 
7140  AU_ENABLE (save);
7141 
7142  if (has_savepoint && error != NO_ERROR && error != ER_LK_UNILATERALLY_ABORTED)
7143  {
7144  (void) tran_abort_upto_system_savepoint (UNIQUE_SAVEPOINT_RENAME_TRIGGER);
7145  }
7146 
7147  if (tr_name)
7148  {
7149  free_and_init (tr_name);
7150  }
7151 
7152  return error;
7153 }
7154 
7155 /*
7156  * tr_set_status() - This changes a trigger status.
7157  * return: error code
7158  * trigger_object(in): trigger object
7159  * status(in): new statue
7160  * call_from_api(in): call from api
7161  *
7162  * Note:
7163  * The possible values are TR_STATUS_ACTIVE and TR_STATUS_INACTIVE.
7164  * We reset the associated cache validation flag when the status changes.
7165  */
7166 int
7167 tr_set_status (DB_OBJECT * trigger_object, DB_TRIGGER_STATUS status, bool call_from_api)
7168 {
7169  int error = NO_ERROR;
7170  TR_TRIGGER *trigger;
7171  DB_TRIGGER_STATUS oldstatus;
7172  DB_VALUE value;
7173  int save;
7174 
7175  AU_DISABLE (save);
7176 
7177  trigger = tr_map_trigger (trigger_object, 1);
7178  if (trigger == NULL)
7179  {
7180  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
7181  }
7182  else if (!check_authorization (trigger, true))
7183  {
7184  error = ER_TR_TRIGGER_ALTER_FAILURE;
7185  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 1, trigger->name);
7186  }
7187  else
7188  {
7189  oldstatus = trigger->status;
7190  trigger->status = status;
7191  db_make_int (&value, status);
7192  if (db_put_internal (trigger_object, TR_ATT_STATUS, &value))
7193  {
7194  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
7195 
7196  /*
7197  * hmm, couldn't set the new status, put the old one back,
7198  * we might need to abort the transaction here ?
7199  */
7200  trigger->status = oldstatus;
7201  }
7202  else
7203  {
7204  /*
7205  * The schema manager maintains a flag indicating whether active triggers are defined for the class.
7206  * When the status of a trigger changes, we need to tell the schema manager to recalculate this flag.
7207  */
7208  if (trigger->class_mop != NULL)
7209  {
7210  error = sm_invalidate_trigger_cache (trigger->class_mop);
7211  }
7212 
7213  /*
7214  * If this is a user trigger, the status will be checked by run_user_triggers
7215  * so the user cache list doesn't have to be recalculated.
7216  */
7217  }
7218  }
7219 
7220  AU_ENABLE (save);
7221 
7222  return error;
7223 }
7224 
7225 /*
7226  * tr_set_priority() - This changes a trigger priority.
7227  * The associated trigger caches are rebuilt to reflect the change in priority.
7228  * return: error code
7229  * trigger_object(in): trigger object
7230  * priority(in): new priority
7231  * call_from_api(in): call from api
7232  */
7233 int
7234 tr_set_priority (DB_OBJECT * trigger_object, double priority, bool call_from_api)
7235 {
7236  int error = NO_ERROR;
7237  TR_TRIGGER *trigger;
7238  double oldpri;
7239  DB_VALUE value;
7240  int save;
7241 
7242  AU_DISABLE (save);
7243 
7244  trigger = tr_map_trigger (trigger_object, 1);
7245  if (trigger == NULL)
7246  {
7247  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
7248  }
7249  else if (!check_authorization (trigger, true))
7250  {
7251  error = ER_TR_TRIGGER_ALTER_FAILURE;
7252  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 1, trigger->name);
7253  }
7254  else
7255  {
7256  oldpri = trigger->priority;
7257  trigger->priority = priority;
7258  db_make_double (&value, priority);
7259  if (db_put_internal (trigger_object, TR_ATT_PRIORITY, &value))
7260  {
7261  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
7262 
7263  /*
7264  * hmm, couldn't set the new status, put the old one back,
7265  * we might need to abort the transaction here ?
7266  */
7267  trigger->priority = oldpri;
7268  }
7269  else
7270  {
7271  if (trigger->class_mop != NULL)
7272  {
7273  /*
7274  * its a class trigger, find all the caches that point to this trigger and cause them to be re-ordered
7275  */
7276  reorder_schema_caches (trigger);
7277  }
7278  else
7279  {
7280  /* this was a user trigger, rebuild the cache */
7281  tr_update_user_cache ();
7282  }
7283  }
7284  }
7285 
7286  AU_ENABLE (save);
7287 
7288  return error;
7289 }
7290 
7291 /*
7292  * tr_set_comment() - This changes a trigger comment.
7293  * return: error code
7294  * trigger_object(in): trigger object
7295  * comment(in): new comment
7296  * call_from_api(in): call from api
7297  *
7298  * Note:
7299  * The possible values are TR_STATUS_ACTIVE and TR_STATUS_INACTIVE.
7300  * We reset the associated cache validation flag when the status changes.
7301  */
7302 int
7303 tr_set_comment (DB_OBJECT * trigger_object, const char *comment, bool call_from_api)
7304 {
7305  int error = NO_ERROR;
7306  TR_TRIGGER *trigger;
7307  DB_VALUE value;
7308  int save;
7309  char *oldcomment = NULL;
7310 
7311  AU_DISABLE (save);
7312 
7313  /* fetch and check the trigger */
7314  trigger = tr_map_trigger (trigger_object, 1);
7315  if (trigger == NULL)
7316  {
7317  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error);
7318  }
7319  else if (!check_authorization (trigger, true))
7320  {
7321  error = ER_TR_TRIGGER_ALTER_FAILURE;
7322  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 1, trigger->name);
7323  }
7324 
7325  if (error == NO_ERROR)
7326  {
7327  oldcomment = (char *) trigger->comment;
7328  assert (comment != NULL);
7329  trigger->comment = strdup (comment);
7330  if (trigger->comment == NULL)
7331  {
7332  trigger->comment = oldcomment;
7333  error = ER_TR_TRIGGER_ALTER_FAILURE;
7334  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, error, 1, trigger->name);
7335  }
7336  else
7337  {
7338  db_make_string_copy (&value, comment);
7339  if (db_put_internal (trigger_object, TR_ATT_COMMENT, &value))
7340  {
7341  error = (er_errid () != NO_ERROR) ? er_errid () : ER_FAILED;
7342  trigger->comment = oldcomment;
7343  }
7344  else
7345  {
7346  if (oldcomment != NULL)
7347  {
7348  free_and_init (oldcomment);
7349  }
7350  }
7351  pr_clear_value (&value);
7352  }
7353  }
7354 
7355  AU_ENABLE (save);
7356 
7357  return error;
7358 }

7447 /* Helper routine for tr_final */
7448 /*
7449  * map_flush_helper() -
7450  * return: int
7451  * key(in):
7452  * data(in):
7453  * args(in):
7454  */
7455 static int
7456 map_flush_helper (const void *key, void *data, void *args)
7457 {
7458  if (data != NULL)
7459  {
7460  free_trigger ((TR_TRIGGER *) data);
7461  }
7462  return NO_ERROR;
7463 }

7466 /*
7467  * tr_final() - Trigger shutdown function.
7468  * return: none
7469  */
7470 void
7471 tr_final (void)
7472 {
7473  flush_deferred_activities ();
7474  tr_free_trigger_list (tr_User_triggers);
7475  tr_free_trigger_list (tr_Uncommitted_triggers);
7476  tr_User_triggers = NULL;
7477  tr_Uncommitted_triggers = NULL;
7478 
7479  /* need to free all trigger structures in the table */
7480  if (tr_object_map != NULL)
7481  {
7482  mht_map (tr_object_map, map_flush_helper, NULL);
7483  mht_destroy (tr_object_map);
7484  tr_object_map = NULL;
7485  }
7486 
7487  /*
7488  * Don't need to explicitly free these now since
7489  * they are allocated in the workspace. May need to change this.
7490  */
7491  tr_Schema_caches = NULL;
7492 }

7494 /*
7495  * tr_dump() - Dump status of the trigger manager.
7496  * return: none
7497  * fpp(in): ouput file
7498  *
7499  * Note:
7500  * Mostly this is used to get a list of the currently deferred activities for debugging purposes.
7501  * Since this list is likely to be generally useful, we should make this available in the API interface as well.
7502  * Possibly a session command too.
7503  */
7504 void
7505 tr_dump (FILE * fpp)
7506 {
7507  TR_DEFERRED_CONTEXT *c;
7508  TR_TRIGLIST *t;
7509 
7510  fprintf (fpp, "TRIGGER MANAGER STATISTICS\n");
7511

7513  if (tr_Deferred_activities == NULL)
7514  {
7515  fprintf (fpp, "No deferred triggers.\n");
7516  }
7517  else
7518  {
7519  fprintf (fpp, "Deferred trigger list:\n");
7520  for (c = tr_Deferred_activities; c != NULL; c = c->next)
7521  {
7522  for (t = c->head; t != NULL; t = t->next)
7523  {
7524  fprintf (fpp, " %s\n", t->trigger->name);
7525  }
7526  }
7527  }
7528 }

7531 /*
7532  * TRIGGER DATABASE INSTALLATION
7533  */
7534 
7535 /*
7536  * define_trigger_classes() - This defines the classes necessary for storing triggers.
7537  * return: error code
7538  *
7539  * Note:
7540  * Currently there is only a single trigger object class.
7541  * This should only be called during createdb.
7542  */
7543 static int
7544 define_trigger_classes (void)
7545 {
7546  DB_CTMPL *tmp;
7547  DB_OBJECT *class_mop;
7548  DB_VALUE value;
7549 
7550  tmp = NULL;
7551 
7552  tmp = dbt_create_class (TR_CLASS_NAME);
7553  if (tmp == NULL)
7554  {
7555  goto tmp_error;
7556  }
7557 
7558  if (dbt_add_attribute (tmp, TR_ATT_OWNER, "db_user", NULL))
7559  {
7560  goto tmp_error;
7561  }
7562 
7563  if (dbt_add_attribute (tmp, TR_ATT_NAME, "string", NULL))
7564  {
7565  goto tmp_error;
7566  }
7567 
7568  db_make_int (&value, TR_STATUS_ACTIVE);
7569  if (dbt_add_attribute (tmp, TR_ATT_STATUS, "integer", &value))
7570  {
7571  goto tmp_error;
7572  }
7573 
7574  db_make_float (&value, TR_LOWEST_PRIORITY);
7575  if (dbt_add_attribute (tmp, TR_ATT_PRIORITY, "double", &value))
7576  {
7577  goto tmp_error;
7578  }
7579 
7580  db_make_int (&value, TR_EVENT_NULL);
7581  if (dbt_add_attribute (tmp, TR_ATT_EVENT, "integer", &value))
7582  {
7583  goto tmp_error;
7584  }
7585 
7586  if (dbt_add_attribute (tmp, TR_ATT_CLASS, "object", NULL))
7587  {
7588  goto tmp_error;
7589  }
7590 
7591  if (dbt_add_attribute (tmp, TR_ATT_ATTRIBUTE, "string", NULL))
7592  {
7593  goto tmp_error;
7594  }
7595 
7596  db_make_int (&value, 0);
7597  if (dbt_add_attribute (tmp, TR_ATT_CLASS_ATTRIBUTE, "integer", &value))
7598  {
7599  goto tmp_error;
7600  }
7601 
7602  if (dbt_add_attribute (tmp, TR_ATT_CONDITION_TYPE, "integer", NULL))
7603  {
7604  goto tmp_error;
7605  }
7606 
7607  if (dbt_add_attribute (tmp, TR_ATT_CONDITION, "string", NULL))
7608  {
7609  goto tmp_error;
7610  }
7611 
7612  db_make_int (&value, TR_TIME_AFTER);
7613  if (dbt_add_attribute (tmp, TR_ATT_CONDITION_TIME, "integer", NULL))
7614  {
7615  goto tmp_error;
7616  }
7617 
7618  if (dbt_add_attribute (tmp, TR_ATT_ACTION_TYPE, "integer", NULL))
7619  {
7620  goto tmp_error;
7621  }
7622 
7623  if (dbt_add_attribute (tmp, TR_ATT_ACTION, "string", NULL))
7624  {
7625  goto tmp_error;
7626  }
7627 
7628  db_make_int (&value, TR_TIME_AFTER);
7629  if (dbt_add_attribute (tmp, TR_ATT_ACTION_TIME, "integer", NULL))
7630  {
7631  goto tmp_error;
7632  }
7633 
7634  if (dbt_add_attribute (tmp, TR_ATT_COMMENT, "varchar(1024)", NULL))
7635  {
7636  goto tmp_error;
7637  }
7638 
7639  class_mop = dbt_finish_class (tmp);
7640  if (class_mop == NULL)
7641  {
7642  goto tmp_error;
7643  }
7644 
7645  if (locator_create_heap_if_needed (class_mop, false) == NULL)
7646  {
7647  goto tmp_error;
7648  }
7649 
7650  return NO_ERROR;
7651 
7652 tmp_error:
7653  if (tmp != NULL)
7654  {
7655  dbt_abort_class (tmp);
7656  }
7657 
7658  ASSERT_ERROR ();
7659  return er_errid ();
7660 }

7664  * return: error code

7668  * The function should be called exactly once in createdb.
7669  */
7670 int
7671 tr_install (void)

7713  * tr_downcase_all_trigger_info() -/

7716 int
7717 tr_downcase_all_trigger_info (void)
7718 {

7722  char *attribute;
